Summary
Posted: Apr 6, 2022
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200356031
The panel process and optics (PPO) team crafts and develops groundbreaking display technologies to support Apple’s excellent product line. This includes total optimization & integration of display material, optics, and process to deliver outstanding optical, mechanical, and reliability performances. The team features a collaborative and hands-on environment that cultivates engineering excellence, creativity, and innovation. As part of Apple design and development team you will be working with some of the smartest and most hardworking people in the field, and will be contributing to exciting new products that will touch lives of millions and enrich your career with invaluable experience. We are looking for a skilled synthetic organic chemist with a consistent track record of design and synthesis of wide range of small molecules and proven understanding of polymer chemistry. Hands-on experience and an extensive background in total synthesis of small organic molecules and polymers is required. Specifically, we are looking for a scientist who understands photoactive compounds and UV chemistry processes. A successful candidate will work with a multi-functional team and external vendors to design, develop, and support materials development efforts for our next-generation products.
Key Qualifications
Ph.D (or M.S. with 5+ years of experience) in organic chemistry, polymer chemistry, polymer science, materials science or related field
5+ years of hands-on experience in small molecule synthesis and characterization of sophisticated photoactive systems (e.g. UV curable materials) with in-depth understanding of structure-process-property relationships of components and polymer products.
Experience in fundamental failure analysis methodology to derive a root cause of failure
Experience and knowledge in product development and ultimate translation to manufacturing
Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Solid collaboration and leadership skills
Willingness and ability to travel
Description
- Design, synthesis, and characterization of novel photo active compounds at both lab and pilot scale. This includes identifying and sourcing raw materials with desired functions, synthesis, characterization and process optimization - Synthesis of high purity photoactive monomers, initiators, and other polymerizable materials to deliver products of desired specification - Process of components into products with desired properties to meet Apple’s product specifications - Develop and validate Critical-to-Quality (CTQ) metrics and quantitative analytical methods from raw material selection to formulation to final component fabrication to ensure all aspects of new product launch initiative are managed and controlled - Correlate materials-level analytical data to final component/system performances to define materials-level and in-process specifications - Lead efforts in failure analysis of both materials and component level issues and develop/validate effective solutions - Transfer synthesis and process findings and specifications to manufacturing partners through effective communication, training, and documentation - Work with multi-functional teams to investigate and explore new functional materials concepts, determine technical feasibility, and project implementation plan beyond initial proof of concept
Education & Experience
M.S. degree or Ph.D. in Chemistry or Material Science
Additional Requirements
If you are a Colorado resident, this is for you:

Synthetic Chemist starts at a minimum annual salary of $91,800. The actual pay may be higher depending on your skills, qualifications, and experience. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Every Apple employee also has the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder, because all team members are eligible for stock grants and also a discount when purchasing Apple stock.

Company Overview
Firestone Polymers, LLC is headquartered in Lake Charles, LA and manufactures polymers and synthetic rubber in our world-class ISO 9001:2015, 14001:2015 registered plant located in Lake Charles, Louisiana. Firestone's unique anionic polymerization technology allows production of high purity, high molecular weight polybutadiene and a wide range of block, random, and vinyl modified styrene-butadiene copolymers. These products are sold around the world for use in tires, impact modification of plastics and hot melt adhesives. Statistical process control is used in every step of the operation. Firestone Polymers, LLC is a subsidiary of Bridgestone Americas, a division of Bridgestone Corporation, the world's largest tire and rubber company.

Overview:
Monitor and lead bioanalytical analysis to support biological activity and clinical studies for a fortune 200 company with some of the most iconic brands! Have a bachelor’s with degree in Analytical Chemistry, Organic Chemistry, or related fields? Have experience in one or more areas of analytical chemistry and bioanalytical assays? If so, we want to speak with you!

We are currently recruiting a Bioanalytical Chemist to join our team in Richmond, VA or we are open to remote work arrangements.

As a Bioanalytical Chemist, you will apply your chemistry knowledge and data analytics skills to provide scientific expertise to Clinical and Biological Activity groups in support of development of novel reduced-harm tobacco products and in compliance with regulatory requirements.

What you will be doing:
Essential activities and responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:
Reconcile/review analytical data to ensure data integrity
Verify/evaluate analytical methodologies (used by both internal or third-party vendors) to ensure methods are fit-for-purpose for quantitative analysis of compounds (biomarkers) in target matrices (biological fluids, tobacco and related products, aerosol and smoke etc.)
Generate bioanalytical study plans in alignment with the analytical data deliverables as specified in the study protocols
Generate the scope of work (SOW) including detailed instructions to be followed by the third-party lab (i.e., sample handling, analysis, and data reporting)
Research and recommend alternative strategies for analysis of new business-critical target compounds
Provide regular reports and presentations on work outputs to customers and management
Cross-train other team members and lab personnel on test methodologies
Read and understand analytical procedures (both internal and third-party supplied)

What we want you to have:
Bachelor of Science in Analytical Chemistry, Organic Chemistry or related fields
5+ years of demonstrated experience and expertise (8 years preferred) in one or more areas of analytical chemistry and bioanalytical assays, with proven capability in a range of analysis categories including separation techniques (e.g., GC and HPLC) and mass spectroscopic techniques (e.g., MS, MS/MS),
Working knowledge of one or more of the following is a plus: biomarker analysis, toxicology assays (e.g., Ames, Neutral Red, etc.)
Proficiency in laboratory skills with the ability to think critically to design and implement experiments independently and with minimal supervision
Solid experience in crafting reports and delivering results in cross-functional group settings
Demonstrated strong client service skills, teamwork, and collaboration
Demonstrated planning and multitasking skills to improve productivity
Demonstrated commitment to open and clear communication, team building, and quality

In addition to the opportunity to apply and develop your skills toward key business objectives, we offer an excellent compensation package including a competitive base salary, comprehensive health/vision/dental insurance, participation in our incentive compensation and deferred profit-sharing programs as well as a relocation assistance.

Develop innovative ICM solutions by incorporating synthetic flow chemistry and other continuous techniques into synthetic processes
Maintain a high level of expertise via relevant scientific and technical literature and proactively apply new ideas to research projects

empower, HPLC, synthetic flow chemistry, organic chemistry, NMR, LCMS, synthetic organic, hplc analysis, PAT, Analytical chemistry, continuous manufacturing, organic chemistry, flow chemistry, batch record

Experience with Process Analytical Technologies (PATs) for process understanding and control (ReactIR, ReactRaman, etc)

Summary of Role
This position’s key function is to provide Research and Development as part of the Synthetic Chemistry Team by conducting research in assigned areas under general supervision using established methodology. Specific responsibilities include: Performing scientific experiments according to existing, approved methods, troubleshooting plant processes to resolve problems, utilize basic analytical techniques to guide research. Incumbents will partner with Analytical Services, New Product Development, Quality Control, Process Support and Operations groups. The position requires execution of the Sterling Values and non-negotiables, as well as expertise in functional competencies included in this position profile.
Responsibilities
Performs synthetic chemistry in support of core department efforts (such as process development, production support, impurity synthesis) by following established processes and procedures. Gain familiarity with chemical processes, development, scale-up and manufacturing.
Develop synthetic plans and execute experiments based on that.
Executes experiments under direct guidance in support of research efforts.
Provides solutions to problems of limited scope and complexity. Exercises judgment within defined policies and procedures to determine appropriate action. Consults more senior scientist and management as appropriate.
Effectively and accurately operates standard laboratory equipment required to conduct synthetic experiments (such as TCU, vacuum pump, drying oven, rotovap, etc). Working knowledge of synthetic/organic techniques (such as reflux, distillations, crystallizations, purifications, synthetic methodologies). Gain familiarity with pilot/production chemical processing and equipment.
Understand basic theory and application of simple to complex analytical techniques (such as HPLC, GC, IR, NMR). Ability to run routine tests following established procedures.
Maintains existing laboratory procedures, technical report and standard operating procedures. Assist with criticality assessment. Basic awareness of regulatory documentation and applicability to the job. Working knowledge of Sterling documentation and associated systems
Maintains and provides notebooks, records, reports, action/check lists and documentation which are current, legible, readily understood, complete and accurate to ensure compliance with established procedures and specifications; and are verifiable as required or requested. Reviews basic documentation for completeness and accuracy.
Provides advice and consultation on common technical issues related to organic chemistry. Consults with more senior scientists and management where appropriate.
May conduct troubleshooting of plant processes to resolve production or quality problems. May evaluate new raw material sources to ensure adequate performance in production. May serves as consultant/technical resource to production/engineering/quality control in areas of expertise.
May assist with the procurement, installation and calibration of laboratory instruments, equipment and supplies to ensure reliable, prompt, precise and accurate test data. May assist with the setup, IQ, OQ and PQ of new equipment.
Performs other appropriate duties as assigned by the Process R&D Manager.
Ensures timely completion and compliance with cGMP and all other relevant company training requirements.
An individual in this position must be able to successfully perform the essential duties and responsibilities listed above. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position.
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Chemistry or related field required with minimum of 9+ years’ experience, OR
Master’s degree in Chemistry or related field with minimum of 2+ years’ experience, OR
Doctoral degree with a 0-2 years of previous experience.
Other Qualifications, Skills and Abilities
This position is eligible for a flexible schedule.
This position is not eligible for remote / hybrid work location.
Physical Demands and Work Environment
The physical demands and work environment described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level is moderate to noisy. Occasionally, employee may be exposed to airborne particles and fumes. Occasionally, employee may be exposed to chemicals. Must have the ability to wear PPE as required. Employee occasionally may be exposed to moving mechanical parts and vibration.

About our group:

The Materials Science Lab at Seagate Fremont Research Center is a leader in chemical analysis, thin film characterization, defect identification, and KPIV/mechanism understanding for magnetic media R&D. The lab works with product development, worldwide materials labs, and manufacturing to understand complicated materials and performance issues, provide solution paths, in-depth analysis, and develop novel applications for lab instrumentation. The lab is well-equipped with a variety of analytical, micro-analytical, spectroscopic, microscopic, and surface sensitive instrumentation: TOF-SIMS, XPS, SEM/EDX, FIB/TEM, AFM, Raman, FTIR, GD-OES, LC/MS, GC/MS, ICP-MS, GPC, IC, TMIC, WCA.
About the role - you will:

Through your understanding of organic/inorganic chemistry, solutions, trace material detection, and instrumentation, you will provide in-depth chemical analysis and analytical expertise while you collaborate with various media design and process groups at Seagate to understand failure mechanisms, improve media yield, qualify incoming raw materials used in media processing and for cleanroom use, troubleshoot process line contaminants, and provide compositional and structural analysis of unknowns
About you:

Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills, excellent written and oral communication, highly self-motivated, comfortable with instrumentation and hands-on work, able to work independently and collaborate across functional teams, strong multi-tasking and time management skills, detail oriented.
Your experience includes:

Bachelor's Degree in Engineering related field (i.,e Electrical, Mechanical, Chemical, Computer Engineering, Materials, Physics, or Information Technology) and 8+ years of experience or Master’s Degree in the same and 5+ years’ experience or PhD and 3+ years’ experience or equivalent experience and education.
You might also have:
Must have hands-on experience and knowledge of GC/MS, LC/MS, GPC, ICP-MS, worked on qualifying incoming raw materials and solvents or synthesis. Strong organic background, comfortable with wet chemistry

Location:

Our Gold LEED-certified Fremont product-design campus drives innovation, bringing together a diverse set of engineering, design, operations, support and administrative teams. The site is equipped with state-of-the-art clean room and lab space. On-site social activities are popular, including our annual BBQ, ice cream social, and holiday events. Wellness programs, gaming rooms and the on-site fitness center help round out and balance your Seagate work-life experience, along with opportunities to give back to our local community.
In response to COVID-19, this position may temporarily begin and be performed virtually. Seagate is actively evaluating the virus and our employees' health and safety are our top priority. In the future, this position will report to and be performed at one of our primary locations

Technology Advancement & Commercialization (TAC) provides scientific and engineering solutions for difficult problems existing in the fields of health, energy, and environment. In TAC, applied research and development, along with prototyping and scale-up activities, are concentrated in numerous research and application labs, as well as in a pilot plant facility located on RTI’s main campus.

TAC’s scientific and engineering experts cover a broad spectrum of disciplines including biomechanical, chemical, electrical, environmental, and mechanical engineering. They commonly work on cross-disciplinary research teams with biologists, chemists, and physicists and are currently looking to add a highly motivated Research Chemist for its materials research program at RTI headquarters in Research Triangle Park, NC

We are currently seeking a highly motivated Research Chemist for our materials research program at RTI headquarters in Research Triangle Park, NC. You will work in catalyst, sorbent and membrane development for gas separations, conversions and water purification. Ideally, you will have a strong background in Metal Organic Frameworks (MOFs) and porous materials and be adaptable to a broad variety of synthetic techniques, characterizations, separations, purifications. You will be able to converse effectively with researchers from a wide variety of backgrounds and expected to work with teams on patents, scientific publications, and proposal writing.

Responsibilities:
Plan and execute experiments and analyze data. Develop and modify experimental protocols in consultation with PI.
Operate lab equipment and perform routine maintenance as needed.
Ensure availability of the necessary materials and equipment to carry out experiments and communicate to PI as needed to maintain continuous workflow.
Keep and maintain laboratory notebooks and conduct data analysis, processing, and presentation.
Write experimental summaries and technical reports, and complete paperwork by assigned dates.
Assist PI with preparation of abstracts, manuscripts, and presentations for dissemination of results.
Perform other related duties as required and/or assigned.
Qualifications:
Master’s level degree in Chemistry or Materials Science with + 5 yrs of research, or
PhD + 2yrs of experience (Post-Doc), with a preference being a PhD with a publication track record.
Recent experience in all or most of the following: MOFs, COFs, porous materials, solid-state chemistry, XRD spectroscopy, TGA, sorption, GC-MS.
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States.

The Industrial Solutions New Technology Development Group is an interdisciplinary team responsible for executing the next-on innovation pipeline across a diverse platform of high-growth businesses included healthcare, OLEDs, display materials, precision parts and conductive inks. This team works in concert with the Industrial Solutions New Business Development team, R&D, legal, product stewardship and process scale-up to (1) complete early-stage scouting and development for new products and applications that open additional addressable markets, (2) providing support to major product launch initiatives in late stage as needed to solve important and challenging technology issues and (3) building new technology capabilities.
This team is looking for an Organic Chemist to lead technical scouting efforts and development of next-gen materials and products in strategic value creation platforms. This role will lead material and formulation development, synthetic design, patentability and communication to technology and business leaders. This role is located at Experimental Station in Wilmington, DE and will require routine coordination with lab technicians, R&D and process scale-up teams, customer-facing resources and global business and commercial stakeholders.
Responsibilities:
Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Partners with marketing and new business development team to identify and assess new research areas for value creation within a business.
Explore new products, applications and platforms through patent landscape analysis, fundamental understanding, experiment design, data analysis, and result interpretation
Develop next-generation materials / products across the Industrial Solutions portfolio
Performs experimental, scientific and technological investigations directed toward the acquisition of new knowledge (i.e., technical scouting and feasibility).
Strong knowledge of the isolation and purification of materials by routine and sophisticated organic chemistry lab techniques (including vacuum/fractional distillation), advanced distillation techniques, recrystallization, extraction, filtration, and liquid chromatography.
Knowledge of small molecule and polymer analytical techniques and spectroscopic methods (including NMR, FT-IR, GC, GC/MS, LC-MS, DSC, TGA, XRF etc)
Prepares documented observations, analyses and interpretations of results, including technical reports, summaries and protocols
Supports development of novel strategies to strengthen and support patent filings and protect intellectual property. Helps to define the strategy for a specific technical area
Documents research leading to patent disclosure or technical and/or scientific advancement.
Technical presentations at company meetings, technical conferences, and customer/partner facilities
Promote a strong safety culture required for a safe working environment

Excellent knowledge of NMR, GC/MS, LC/MS, FT-IR as well as interpretation of the respective data
Effective verbal and written communication on all aspects of program activity, including demonstrated ability to make clear, persuasive, concise, and well-organized oral presentations

At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our 35,000 employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We’re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.
For more than 140 years, Eli Lilly has been dedicated to meeting the health care needs of people around the world. We address these needs primarily by developing innovative medicines—investing heavily in research and development. Lilly credits its exceptional employees for its success, and recognizes that the key to ongoing achievement lies in attracting and retaining the best people.
Do you have strong Synthetic Organic or Medicinal Chemistry skills with working knowledge of modern synthetic chemistry methodologies? If you can contribute examples of scientific creativity and ability to ideate in teams solving problems through hypothesis-based experimental design apply today!
The Discovery Chemistry & Technologies organization within Lilly Research Laboratories is growing and seeks hardworking scientists to join our Medicinal Chemistry group. We're looking for an excellent scientist with a strong attention to detail, trouble-shooting skills, a high level of learning agility, the willingness to work across teams. We are an innovative and dynamic team looking to enhance our diverse capabilities in drug discovery. We are committed to continually improving our abilities to make life better for patients around the globe. Consider joining our growing team!
Responsibilities
Perform Compound Synthesis, Purification and Characterization under the direction of senior scientific staff:
Design – in collaboration with colleagues in Medicinal Chemistry, Computational Chemistry and Molecular Pharmacology – new molecules to address hypotheses and issues in portfolio projects.
Design and implement multi-step synthetic routes towards targeted compounds.
Independently set up and complete a variety of organic chemistry reactions, including those with air sensitive and hygroscopic reagents.
Perform routine purification of synthetic intermediates and final products using techniques such as TLC, HPLC, flash chromatography and other related methods.
Characterize reaction products by NMR, MS and other routine methods.
Rigorously document laboratory experimentation and employ safe laboratory practices.
Contribute in an integrated, multi-disciplinary, drug discovery research team:
Actively contribute to a high quality design and synthesis research laboratory.
Integrate emerging analytical chemistry, computational design technologies, automation chemistry, and biophysical methods into drug discovery.
Demonstrate strong oral and written communication skills.
Basic Qualifications Requirements:
B.S. or M.S. in Chemistry, Organic/Medicinal Chemistry or related field with experience or training in a synthetic or medicinal chemistry.
Additional Skills/Preferences:
Strong academic performance.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Ability to work well independently, as well as in local and global team environments.

Solvay is a science company whose technologies bring benefits to many aspects of daily life. In a world facing an ever-growing population and quest for resources, we aim to be the driving force triggering the next breakthroughs to enable humanity to advance while protecting the planet we all share.
We bond with customers and partners to address today and tomorrow’s megatrends. As a global leader in Materials, Chemicals and Solutions, Solvay brings advancements in planes, cars, batteries, smart and medical devices, water and air treatment, to solve critical industrial, social and environmental challenges. You can count on our innovative solutions to contribute to safer, cleaner and more sustainable future.
Role Overview
The Chemist is responsible for implementing strategic experimental R&D initiatives via active collaboration with a Research Scientist. They are responsible for planning, executing, and reporting laboratory experiments/results for small molecule and polymer syntheses and characterizations.

Key Responsibilities:
Maintain a safe work environment for self and others.
Devise and carry out detailed experimental plans for the synthesis of polymers and small organic molecules at lab scale via active collaboration with a Research Scientist.
Communicate experimental observations and preliminary data and analysis in written and verbal.
Prepare and submit samples for analysis; collect, organize data and communicate to research scientists
Document experiments and results in a laboratory notebook and in a monthly report.
Operate and maintain relevant equipment, instrumentation and experimental techniques.
Conduct preventative maintenance on laboratory equipment, including specifying and getting quotes on parts, installations and repairs from outside resources.
Participates in peer and area coordinator safety audits and attends all required safety meetings & training.
Maintains relevant Certified Operator status and adheres to relevant work area SOPs and processes.

Desired Qualifications:
B. S. Degree in Chemistry, Polymer Science, or related technical field
Experience in wet chemistry (organic chemistry polymer synthesis preferred).
Relevant experience in polymer and/or small molecule synthesis and characterization.
Strong experimental/bench skills. Interest in working in the lab 90% of the time.
Good understanding of modern characterization methods.(e.g. DSC, TGA, GPC, NMR, FT-IR, titration).
Demonstrated ability to solve technical challenges when they arise.
Capability to identify improvements to current chemistry and processes.
Demonstrated ability to propose solutions to solve problems.
Interest in seeking solutions to technical challenges/roadblocks through consultation with the literature.
Attention to detail and ability to work meticulously to observe and adjust/improve processes and experiments as needed.
Ability to analyze, compile, organize, and present complex data sets in a meaningful way.

Collaborative style of working with genuine interest/passion for organic chemistry and polymer science.
Ideal candidate will be well-organized, creative, pragmatic problem solver, who is driven, high achieving, and excellent at communicating both written and verbal.

Location(s): Alpharetta (Georgia, USA)
Additional Information
Solvay’s purpose is to bond people, ideas and elements to reinvent progress. Basic Function
Perform work in a collaborative research and development environment involving the synthesis of new materials (i.e. organic, inorganic or combinations thereof) and game changing method and processes for upstream oil and gas applications in the areas of productivity enhancement including fracturing and matrix stimulation fluids, sand control, water shutoff to increase production and recovery from conventional and unconventional reservoirs.
Duties & Responsibilities
Lead and/or participate in research and development efforts involving the synthesis of new chemicals and materials (i.e. organic, inorganic or combinations thereof) for upstream oil and gas production applications
Laboratory experience in synthesis, isolation and purification of organic molecules, polymers and/or hybrid organic-inorganic materials
Keep current with significant developments in the field of specialization and industry trends and technologies; this includes synthesizing or formulating new chemicals, design customized experimental setup and procedure, and evaluate performance for the products
Demonstrated ability to perform material characterization and testing using an assortment of analytical instrument and methods, e.g. NMR, FT-IR, TGA, elemental analysis, GC-MS, HPLC
Design and carry out state-of-the-art synthesis with minimum supervision in a collaborative research environment
Develop new intellectual property, work with IP personnel to patent developed technology
Ability to disseminate results through high impact journal publications, reports and presentations
Provide and manage a safe, accident-free laboratory environment; follow all company safety rules in performing job duties
Lead collaborative research with other R&D areas of the company, e.g., organic chemistry, process engineering, applications, etc. for increased intellectual property opportunities and future business advancement of ASC or Saudi Aramco
Serve as a leader scientist or participates in major investigative projects as assigned
Perform other miscellaneous related duties as requested
Education and Experience
Ph.D. degree in Synthetic Organic Chemistry or Polymer Science is highly preferred
Seven years (7) experience in a substantive industrial, technological or laboratory area relevant to organic synthesis/ polymer synthesis
Must have demonstrated experience at the research and development level with a high degree of technical competency ranging from the synthesis of small molecules and building blocks, to resins and precursors to functionalized polymeric, colloidal and nanomaterials
Adhere to health, safety and environment guidelines and follow chemical hygiene plan
Ability to multitask and effectively manage several projects

Candidate should be comfortable in working independently and as part of a project team, frequent project presentation and travel to meetings at conferences and universities

600. That's the number of chemists globally at the Novartis Institutes for Biomedical Research (NIBR) who will be your colleagues, collaborators, mentors, and guides in the creation of new medicines. The Global Discovery Chemistry Department (GDC) working across seven disease areas at NIBR, is seeking a motivated chemist to join our team in Cambridge, MA.

Here, we value your ideas, professional development, and career aspirations. You will collaborate with and learn from curious colleagues across multiple scientific subject areas; you will have opportunities to explore the power of innovative science and technology; you will be empowered to take sensible risks, and to use your creativity and resourcefulness to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.

We are looking for individuals with expertise in chemical science and scientific leadership skills. Successful candidates are:

1. Insightful, collaborative, and decisive project contributors

2. Driven by the goal to create new medicines with urgency

3. Creative and curious lab-based scientists

4. Dynamic individuals with high learning agility

Your responsibilities include:

Contributing at all stages of the drug discovery process, from project inception to early development.

Applying experience and innovative methods to solve challenges in compound synthesis and diversification; advising other chemists locally and globally on matters of organic chemistry.

Working closely with other experts in multi-disciplinary teams, you will identify key drug discovery issues, propose and implement creative solutions, execute on innovative medicinal chemistry designs, and guide teams to success and decision points.

Developing leadership skills to help drive project strategy, and providing insightful guidance to tackle medicinal chemistry problems.



What you will bring to the role:

a PhD in organic chemistry with 0-3 years of industrial experience, or a BS/MS with equivalent related experience.

A record of scientific achievement from the lab exemplified by peer-reviewed publications, conference presentations, and/or patent inventorship.

Strong laboratory presence and experience mentoring scientists.

Outstanding communication skills

A natural curiosity and desire for learning and growth

Why Novartis?

766 million lives were touched by Novartis medicines in 2021, and while we’re proud of this, we know there is so much more we could do to help improve and extend people’s lives.

We believe new insights, perspectives and ground-breaking solutions can be found at the intersection of medical science and digital innovation. That a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment inspires new ways of working.

We believe our potential can thrive and grow in an unbossed culture underpinned by integrity, curiosity and flexibility. And we can reinvent what's possible, when we collaborate with courage to aggressively and ambitiously tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges. Because the greatest risk in life, is the risk of never trying!

Imagine what you could do here at Novartis!

JOB POSTING: CHEMIST
The Research and Development department is paramount in the success of the business by formulating, testing, and analyzing the materials in its most organic compound and developing sustainable and/or the best materials for the final product suitable for residential and commercial use.
This position is a leadership role in polyurethane formulation chemistry, making coated samples, and testing these with necessary chemical and mechanical tests. We will rely heavily on the technical expertise of such chemistries and the resultant coatings created. Additionally, this role must keep the entire chemistry and formulation process from beginning to end in strict confidence.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
· Plan and develop products and achieve cost-performance optimization for both existing and new products.
· Provide technical oversight and expertise as required.
· Oversee the entire development process of new products and programs within an organization, from the initial planning phase to implementation or production.
· Keep the entire development process of new, current, and old products confidential from the public and competitors. Only approved need to know individuals will have access to the process upon Owner’s written approval.
· Coordinate with other departments to exchange, update products information.
· Evaluation of competitors’ products to compare with company’s similar products.
· Assist in sourcing and evaluating new raw materials to ensure products conformity and competitiveness.
· Document all R&D procedures and reports and monitor implemented programs to ensure efficient use of resource.
· Solve problems with the use of chemistry, instrumentation, computers, and statistics, and interpret data while being able to communicate results to Owner.
Strong knowledge of concrete, polymer coatings, pigments, vinyl, UV stabilizers, and other coatings and additives along with a familiarity of the lab and production-scale processing.
Manage detailed, professional QC processes, from raw material intake to final product formulations.
Troubleshoot, clean, and maintain laboratory equipment and supplies.
Follow laboratory SOPs to prepare and test samples using traditional laboratory technologies.
Accurately interpret and record data in an organized, legible, and consistent manner.
Verify lab equipment before use to ensure they are within acceptable limits.
Perform special projects, as assigned.
Experience and Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree or higher in Chemistry or Polymer Chemistry or Chemical Engineering
Minimum 5 years of working experience and 3 years of relevant experience in R&D laboratory field
Strong knowledge of construction chemicals including Polyurethane and/or Polyaspartic
Able to work as part of a team in a fast-paced environment
Able to interact professionally with colleagues and bring up concerns immediately when you are faced with them
Great written and verbal communication skills
Excellent laboratory troubleshooting skills
Detail and accuracy oriented

$100k-$130k depending on experience, qualifications, skillsets

The R&D Chemist provides technical support involving the synthesis of custom chemicals, chemical analysis, and technical aspects of the company’s production processes and the development of new products. They will be involved with kilo-lab scale and pilot plant facilities, provide support for technology transfer to production facilities, design, enable and develop scalable processes, apply innovative chemistries, and new technologies and statistical experimental design approaches in a laboratory setting. This individual must have the ability to work on and lead multi-disciplinary teams involving chemists, analysts, and engineers, and be able to represent R&D on cross-functional teams. The R&D Chemist will be the primary investigator/project leader and serve as contact with the internal and external company customers, provide project updates, and chair meetings while also participating in key initiatives for R&D and contribute to continuous improvement work in the department.
Skills and Abilities:
M.S./Ph.D. in synthetic Organic Chemistry or equivalent experience.
Experience in a contract research organization (CRO) or contract manufacturing organization (CMO) environment is desirable.
5+ years of experience in process development for scale up of intermediates and final products from R&D lab to Kilo lab/pilot plant facilities.
Industrial experience in laboratory synthesis of and safe handling of organic, inorganic, and organometallic compounds, catalysts, and polymeric materials.
Collaboration with scientists/engineers from Analytical, R&D, and other disciplines, such as process engineering and production, to advance synthetic routes into commercial processes.
Track record of innovative thinking and technical accomplishments and utilization of analytical tools, technical knowledge, data, computational and statistical tools, etc. to solve technical challenges and enhance chemistries and process development.
Proficient in standard analytical techniques (TLC, NMR, HPLC, LC/MS, GC, etc.) and separation technologies, such as distillation, column chromatography, and crystallization.
Able to perform independent research in a multidisciplinary environment and cooperatively as part of a multidisciplinary team.
Excellent organizational and communication (written and verbal) skills and the ability to effectively influence the work of others.
Interpret and communicate results to colleagues, company, and clients
Supervisory and mentoring skills.
Travel requirements: Travel is required on occasion in support of external manufacture or to participate in scientific conferences.
Salary and Benefits: Salary level is commensurate with experience, competitive with comparable professionals. Package includes full medical and dental health insurance, with 100% of premiums paid by the company. 401K with company match, AD&D, Life Insurance, vacation, paid holidays, and sick time.
Wiley Companies is an equal opportunity employer and is dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination upon the basis of age, race, gender, creed, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, political belief, or disability. Candidates must be legal residents of the United States and have legal work status through citizenship or work visa. Candidates must pass a drug screen prior to employment.'

Company Name: Proteogenomics Research Institute for Systems Medicine
Job Description:
General Description:
The Proteogenomics Research Institute for Systems Medicine (PRISM) is a biomedical research institute leading the way in development of novel treatments for cancer. PRISM is currently seeking a highly motivated, detail oriented, well organized research scientist with skills in bioconjugation chemistry to participate in development of antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs) with different linker chemistry. The individual will be a critical part of our studies, supporting preclinical development of immunotargeted agents for cancer treatment.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
The successful candidate will primarily focus on the ADC development and production - bioconjugations, optimization and analytical characterization of antibody drug conjugations for therapeutic studies. The candidate is expected to work in a highly collaborative fast-paced environment, to be self-motivated, well-organized and capable of working independently.
Qualifications/Experience/Skills:
PhD degree in organic chemistry, biochemistry or related is preferred. M.S. with equivalent experience will be considered.
Expertise in synthetic organic chemistry and/or biochemistry, with > 3 years of post-graduate experience in areas of protein bioconjugations. Experience in field of antibody-drug conjugates or nanomedicines/nanotechnology is highly desirable.
Deep understanding of bioconjugation chemistry principles particularly conjugation of small molecules to proteins is highly desirable.
Familiarity with operation of HPLC instruments is required.
Experience with analytical techniques such as ESI, LC/MS, NMR, MALDI/TOF MS, and UV/VIS spectrophotometry.
Maintain detailed experimental records in electronic and hardcopy formats, and prepare presentations.
Ability to learn new skills quickly and demonstrate initiative and follow-through in problem-solving.
Detail oriented, highly organized, and the ability to work with minimal supervision.
Must be proactive, co-operative, and willing to work in a fast-paced small team environment.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Desirable Qualifications:
Background in techniques of bioconjugational chemistry using different linkers, particularly for attachment of therapeutic drugs to antibodies to generate ADCs. While not essential, experience with in vitro cell cytotoxicity assays and ELISA would be plus.

Job Description – Entry Level Chemist/QC Chemist
Synthex Organics is a leading edge full-service chemical manufacturer in your area and has immediate openings for Production Laborers in our Altoona, Pennsylvania facility.
Pay scale beginning at $15.00/hour with opportunity for additional earning potential after 90-day probationary period.
Job Summary
Full time duties to include quality control testing, assisting in formula development, and synthesis work. BS in chemistry or a science discipline desired but not required. This position will work solely out of our Altoona, PA production facility. One to two years commercial/industrial laboratory experience a plus, but we are willing to train a candidate that matches our company philosophies.
Primary Responsibilities and Duties
Takes ownership of Quality Control lab with respect to housekeeping and organization.
Able to work together with production to receive batch samples and report findings in a timely manner.
Meticulously record data, take pride in work and report consistent findings.
Escalate any out-of-specification occurrences as soon as known.
Work with Research Laboratory in deployment of new products to the production floor.
Ability to perform simple mathematics to achieve proper batch weight for final products.
Remain calm in a fast-paced environment, take pride in your work.
Maintains quality and quantity production standards.
Properly dispose of all necessary waste only as designated by production supervisor.
Other (Non-Essential) Functions
Communicates with Supervisors, Operators, and Adjusters on and off shift.
Complies with safety rules and regulations (wear proper safety attire; steel toed shoes or coverings, hearing protection when necessary, safety glasses, shields and gloves as needed), is not involved in horseplay, is cautious when near equipment and machines, always make sure safety guards are in place and operational. Maintains clean machine and work area (sweeps, removes waste, etc).
Other duties as assigned.
Physical Requirements & Environmental Conditions
Regularly required to stand or walk.
Frequently lift and/or move up to 55 pounds.
Must be able to climb steps to load raw materials.
Must be able to climb ladders on tank trucks, utilizing all proper fall protection techniques.
Occasional exposure to hazardous materials – all employees will be familiar with readily available SDS sheets and proper PPE requirements for all materials handled.
Benefits
Full company paid medical, dental and vision insurance.
Supplemental and Life Insurance Available
401k Plan Eligibility after 1 year
7 Paid Holidays
1-week paid vacation after 6 months of service, 2-weeks after 1 year.
Production Based Bonus Potential

JOB DESCRIPTION
Job Title:
Analytical Chemist
Job Purpose:
Provide high-level analytical chemistry expertise to the company. Lead scientist for the laboratory’s operation and associated instrumentation. Serve as a back-up to the
Laboratory Director.
Job Duties:
Reporting to the Laboratory Director, the Analytical Chemist is responsible for all aspects of the laboratory including operation, maintenance, troubleshooting, data collection and analysis, and reporting/presenting of chemical and analytical output.
Devise technically competent test methods and study protocols, execute the studies, and create clear, concise reports in a timely manner.
Develop chromatographic and mass spectral methods for current and emerging business opportunities, e.g., development of acid hydrolysis (e.g., HCl, HF,
HNO3) microwave digestion methods for ICP-MS sample preparation.
Communicate as needed with clients to clarify requirements
Keep UPLC/MS, ICP-MS, and GC/MS instrumentation operational for successful daily use by maintaining laboratory supplies and performing routine maintenance and weekly surveillance.
Handle a range of organic chemical sample preparations, syntheses, and polymerizations utilizing organic solvents (e.g., tetrahydrofuran, acetonitrile, toluene, methylene chloride) and monomers (methyl methacrylate, other acrylate monomers).
Perform physical duties such as routine instrumentation maintenance, e.g., replace vacuum pump oil, interchange compressed gas cylinders and dewars, maintain solvent supplies for analytical equipment.
Travel as required for training, conference booth attendance, and client meetings.
Support the maintenance and promotion of the InVision Biomedical Quality
System and Quality Objectives
Skills/Qualifications:
Demonstrated ability to define an analytical problem, devise the program to solve problem, and execute the program to completion.
Strong oral and written communication skills. Must be fluent in English.
Good computer skills including Word, Excel, and instrument software.

Essential is a privately owned company that sells its ability to help companies create their next-generation coatings. We expect to deliver our customers a WOW experience when working with us. We believe in the challenge of problem-solving and that learning from our mistakes is more powerful than learning from our successes. We find it fun to discover new solutions, invent new polymers and technologies, and work with our customers to find new and creative ways to solve their problems.
Job Profile:
Join our R&D polymer team at Essential Industries as a Chemist I.
This team member will be responsible for developing new water-based acrylic emulsion polymers and polyurethane dispersions to fit the customer's needs. They will be responsible for developing the polymer and evaluating its performance in a starting point formulation. They will also be responsible to work with the process engineers and chemical operators to scale up the formulations from lab to pilot to full production.
Key Responsibilities
Assist in the analysis of all Essential’s products, intermediates, and raw materials to ensure they meet specifications and customer requirements.
Ensure all required QC tests are performed in coordination with the production schedule.
Assist in the data entry of the Quality Control results.
Operate and maintain QC instrumentation in a safe and professional manner.
Assist in developing polymers for the coatings industries.
Assist in formulating the polymers into a coatings formulation and then perform the appropriate physical testing and report the results.
Qualifications and Skills:
BA, BS in Polymer Chemistry, Organic Chemistry or related field.
0-3 years experience in emulsion polymerization, polyurethane dispersions or a closely related field.
Effective communication with internal teams, as well as with customers.
Understanding and the use of Design of Experiments is a plus.
Ability to perform intermediate mathematical calculations, such as stoichiometry.
Microsoft Office experience
Having a passion to solve problems by developing new and innovative solutions.
Physical Requirements:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. This requires the ability to lift, move bend, and stand, as well as lift 20+ lbs as necessary.

Job Description
Vertex Pharmaceuticals has an exciting opportunity for a research scientist in the field of medicinal chemistry. Job responsibilities include the preparation of both single and focused sets of small organic molecules, developing and optimizing synthetic methods, creating and interpreting project-relevant Structure-Activity Relationship (SAR) and problem solving. Candidates must demonstrate an expert understanding of organic reaction mechanisms, formulation of executable synthetic routes, up to date understanding of contemporary synthetic methods as well as an ability to balance rational concepts with creativity which includes the development of new synthetic methodology as needed. The successful candidate will have the ability to work independently and be able to multi-task collaboratively in teams while adapting to rapidly changing needs. A strong desire to grow as a medicinal chemist while maintaining a passion for organic chemistry and the courage to challenge conventional wisdom are essential in this role.
Key Responsibilities:
Maintain a high level of productivity in the laboratory setting
Develops and executes clear synthetic routes using state-of-the-art synthetic methodologies
Primarily responsible for executing organic syntheses in a timely, efficient, and independent manner
Create and interpret SAR with a clear understanding of the biological data
Organize and triage efforts to stay consistent with project priorities
Clearly and effectively communicate ideas and results (both verbally and in writing) to a broad range of audiences
Knowledge and Skills:
Designs and executes complex, challenging chemistry experiments
Demonstrates astute understanding of his/her own discipline and the relevant literature
Maintains a high level of knowledge related to current developments in the scientiﬁc Project ﬁeld
Displays proven productivity and experimental creativity, and effective dissemination of ideas
Demonstrates effective, self-sufﬁcient communication skills, especially in peer-directed presentations
Demonstrates awareness of other project-related disciplines and an understanding of general concepts and some experimental detail within those areas
Education and Experience:
Ph.D. (or equivalent degree) in chemistry or related science 0-3 years of relevant post-doctoral employment experience, or
Master’s degree (or equivalent degree) in chemistry or related science and 3+ years of relevant employment experience, or
Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent degree) in chemistry or related science and 6+ years of relevant employment experience
Demonstrated effective communication skills, both verbal and written
Ability to navigate and be successful in a fast-paced, highly matrixed work environment
A desire to be part of a highly innovative company aimed at transforming the lives of people with serious diseases, their families and society
Company Information
Vertex is a global biotechnology company that invests in scientific innovation.
Vertex is committed to equal employment opportunity and non-discrimination for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to a person's race, color, sex, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, marital status, or any characteristic protected under applicable law. Vertex is an E-Verify Employer in the United States. Vertex will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.
Please note that Vertex requires COVID-19 vaccination for all employees working in the U.S. as a condition of employment at Vertex, subject to medical, religious or other accommodations or exemptions required by law. We believe this requirement is vital to keeping everyone at Vertex and in our communities safe. This requirement applies to both existing and new employees who may at any time work on-site at a Vertex facility or visit another location on behalf of Vertex (e.g., conferences, customer visits, etc.), including all remote employees. Any applicant requiring an accommodation in connection with the hiring process and/or to perform the essential functions of the position for which the applicant has applied should make a request to the recruiter or hiring manager, or contact Talent Acquisition at ApplicationAssistance@vrtx.com.

Dipharma Inc., formerly Kalexsyn, is seeking an experienced and motivated process route development chemist to join our highly regarded chemistry team in Kalamazoo, MI. The ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate accomplishments in both laboratory work and in the design and optimization of synthetic routes that are amenable to scale-up to kilo scale and beyond. This position requires a hands-on bench chemist that can carry out organic syntheses on milligram to kilogram scale. Experience with the use of reactors having 15 to 50 L capacity is a plus.
PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Early-stage optimization and scale-up (to kilo scale) of chemical syntheses and processes.
Design of scalable synthetic routes for a wide variety of target compounds.
Use of analytical techniques for characterization of products and impurities (HPLC, LCMS, NMR).
Independent problem solving and ability to meet project goals in a timely fashion.
Report writing and communication with clients.
QUALIFICATIONS
Preferred candidates will have a PhD or MS. Strong BS candidates with 3+ years of experience with process development and scale-up experience will also be considered. A strong working knowledge of organic reactions and mechanisms is required, as is a demonstrated ability to solve complex synthetic organic problems in the laboratory using technical expertise and literature resources. A broad knowledge of purification techniques for small molecules is expected. Candidates must also be proficient with computers, electronic notebooks, and electronic literature searching using SciFinder. Individuals must be authorized to work in the US and not need sponsorship. Dipharma is currently unable to sponsor visas.

About Us
HA International’s history is rich in product innovations, customer focus and strategic growth. Our parent company, Hüttenes Albertus is the leading international manufacturer of chemical products for the foundry industry. We are thrilled to be among a network of subsidiary and affiliated companies that support the foundry industry worldwide!
What makes HA-International a great place to work?
We work in a small, fast-paced, cross-functional environment where R&D partners closely with New Business Development and Technical Service teams for new products and troubleshooting formulations.
We have low employee turnover due to our supportive work environment and listening to our employees.
We have a great team that lives our core values by fostering relationships with our associates, customers and vendors.
We offer competitive pay and quarterly bonuses.
We provide great benefits, including up to $10,000 in tuition reimbursement per year!
We offer flexible/hybrid schedule options.
The Details
Education and Experience:
The successful candidate will be an experienced Research & Development Chemist who has excellent technical, analytical and laboratory skills within the foundry industry.
Minimum Requirements:
B.S. degree in Generic, Organic Chemistry or other Technical Degree (example-Mechanical, Chemical or Metallurgical Engineering) and 2-3 years chemical industry experience.
2-4 years industrial experience / foundry experience is preferred
Ability to read, analyze and interpret common scientific and technical journals, technical procedures or government regulations.
Synthesizes complex or diverse information, collects and researches data and uses intuition and experience to complement data.
Ability to write technical reports and business correspondence.
Ability to troubleshoot and manage laboratory equipment.
Computer literacy with databases, word processing, and spreadsheets.
Excellent communication/interpersonal skills required
Ability to work as part of a team; must be able to cooperate and communicate well with others
You’re a standout candidate if you:
Are someone that has a natural curiosity and are passionate about science.
You enjoy working in dynamic and challenging environments where each day presents new challenges.
You’re a self-starter, have a positive attitude, and love problem-solving.
Demonstrates creativity necessary for innovative approaches and ideas to develop new products
Have experience with databases such as SAP and Minitab
As a member of the R&D team, you will be responsible for:
Conducting research and development projects as assigned.
Providing formulation guidance and product support to process engineering and production.
Transferring lab scale process to pilot and production levels and establishing specifications.
Assist Manufacturing and Production team with troubleshooting and formulation adjustments as needed.
Assist Quality Assurance team in testing raw material and finished goods for quality control purposes as needed.
Preparing reports, writing technical papers and giving technical presentations as appropriate to develop reputation and market presence.
Completing lab work requests submitted through the company’s project database system.
Participate in laboratory safety training programs and maintain a safe working environment.
Location
Westmont, Illinois
Travel
As needed to visit plant locations and/or customers, up to 10%.

Performs related work as assigned.

Skill in the use of physical and chemical analyses and interpretation of results.

At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.
We are seeking a talented and motivated Ph.D. level organic chemist who is passionate about organic synthesis and joining a world-class group of employees in the pursuit of innovative therapies at our Cambridge, MA location. The successful candidate must have multi-year experience working in Synthetic Organic Chemistry with evidence of collaborative team work. The candidate will contribute to the scale-up synthesis of molecules from medicinal chemistry to support toxicological evaluation in-vivo. As such, the candidate will be responsible for independently planning and executing synthetic organic chemistry reactions to efficiently obtain desired targets with relevant characterization data. The interpretation and communication of reaction observations and compound data to his/her supervisor and the project team will require the candidate to have good communication skills and a naturally collaborative style.
Qualifications
A Ph.D. degree in Organic Chemistry
Minimum 0-4 years’ experience in synthetic organic chemistry
Broad range of synthetic organic chemistry knowledge which includes the planning and execution of multi-step synthetic reactions.
Demonstrated technical expertise in Synthetic Organic Chemistry with knowledge of scale-up and process chemistry. Working knowledge of Analytical and Separation technology.
Skilled in purification techniques: column chromatography, distillation, crystallization, etc.
Demonstrated ability to fully characterize small molecules by NMR, LC/MS and interpret the data
Strong communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively under direct supervision, in a fast-paced, matrixed, team environment.
Excellent planning, organization, and time management skills
Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.
Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.
Physical presence at the BMS worksite or physical presence in the field is an essential job function of this role which the Company deems critical to collaboration, innovation, productivity, employee well-being and engagement, and enhances the Company culture.

Job Title: Associate Chemist for the Toxicology Lab
Job Description:
Are you an experienced Medical Lab Professional? Are you looking to embark on a new challenge in your career, or start your career in Medical Lab Science? If so, LabCorp wants to speak with you about exciting opportunities to join our team as an Associate Chemist in the Toxicology department in Burlington, NC. In this position you will work in a fast paced, customer focused, and challenging environment, and will be a part of our overall mission at LabCorp: "Improving Health, Improving Lives".
The Toxicology department consists of 4 sub departments: Toxicology, Biological Monitoring, Blood Lead and Mass Spectrometry. These have a combined volume of approximately 500,00 tests a month. Our toxicology tests are primarily focused on therapeutic drug monitoring, our biological monitoring tests focus on metal or chemical exposures and our mass spec department is our most rapidly growing area and encompasses testing from several disciplines from toxicology to endocrinology. The Toxicology department offers experience with many types of analytical instrumentation such as GC, GC/MS, HPLC, ICP/MS and LC/MS/MS as well as with automated and manual systems of sample preparation. Position is in the LC/MS Data Review/Operator Section of Toxicology. Position will be responsible for reviewing and certifying LC/MS data utilizing Analyst and Ascent software.
The schedule for the position will be 1st shift (Monday-Friday 8am-4:30pm)
Job responsibilities:
Manage calibration, quality controls, and patient data up to and including result entry.
Performs minor troubleshooting/repair and instrument prep of LC/MS systems
Gains knowledge of department operations and procedures under direct supervision and in an entry-level capacity.
Conducts qualitative and quantitative analyses on organic and inorganic samples to determine their chemical properties.
Participates in development of new analytical procedures.
Gains knowledge of department operations and procedures.
Requirements:
Bachelor's Science in Biology, Chemistry, Medical Technology or related Life Science.
Must have at least 3 years of clinical laboratory experience with preference given for Chromatographic Data Review experience.
Attention to detail.
Knowledge of automated and manual systems of sample preparation.

Stryker is hiring for a Chemist I located in Cary, IL!
Who we want -
Strategic thinkers. People who enjoy analyzing data or trends for the purposes of planning, forecasting, advising, budgeting, reporting, or sales opportunities.
Collaborative partners. People who build and leverage cross-functional relationships to bring together ideas, data and insights to drive continuous improvement in functions.
Analytical problem solvers. People who go beyond just fixing to identify root causes, evaluate optimal solutions, and recommend comprehensive upgrades to prevent future issues.
What you will do -
The position of QC Chemist I is responsible for performing advanced analytical analysis of raw materials, in-process solutions, stability, finished goods, cleaning samples, as well as general laboratory support.
Performs routine and non-routine analysis for raw materials, in-process solutions, stability, and finished goods including, but not limited to identification testing, refractive index, density, viscosity, water activity, pH, appearance, taste, and smell testing. Additionally, perform more advanced analytical testing such as limits tests, titration, water determination, assay, and impurities testing
Conducts pharmaceutical water testing including but not limited to nitrate testing, total organic carbon (TOC), and conductivity.
Responsible for analytical analysis of cleaning validation and surveillance samples. •Prepare solutions used for routine and non-routine analysis, such as buffers and diluents.
Manages sample coordination prior to and following testing activities. •Responsible for ordering and stocking supplies.
Performs laboratory maintenance activities including but not limited to equipment preventative maintenance, calibration, disposal of waste, and cleaning laboratory areas.
Performs other activities as needed.
What you need -
Required
Bachelor’s Degree in Chemistry or other related technical field
2 years working in a GxP laboratory environment.
Experience working in a laboratory environment.
The ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications.
Strong written and oral communication skills (English).
Experience working in current Good Manufacturing Practice (cGMP) or other cGxP environments
Experience with common laboratory equipment such as balances, graduated cylinders, etc.
Experience with common analytical methods such as chromatography, spectroscopy, etc. Preferred:
Experience conducting compendial analytical testing.
Experience working with Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS).

Gelest, Inc., part of the Mitsubishi Chemical Corporation, is seeking qualified individuals to join our small and large-scale production operations as a Process Chemist.
Gelest is a specialty chemical company that has been experiencing steady growth which results in a fast paced and challenging work environment. Gelest provides hands on equipment training by our technical staff as well as training in the areas of synthetic chemistry and silicone polymer chemistry. The Process Chemist must possess the knowledge and ability to perform all duties associated with the small and large scale production of specialty chemicals.

Responsibilities:
This position requires the following physical and mental demands consisting of, but not limited to the following:
Process development, scale-up and manufacturing of various organosilanes, silicones and metal-organic compounds on a scale from 1 liter to multi-tons.
Independently carry out chemical reactions, perform purification techniques and evaluate analytical results of synthesized products.
Follow the prescribed processes for the synthesis and purification of organosilanes and metal organic compounds in a safe manner.
Record detailed descriptions, including comments, for potential improvements of the work done.
Perform preliminary and in-process analytical and paper works on reactions.
Operating various pieces of production and support equipment, handling drums of material, operating analytical equipment, forklifts and other equipment as needed.
Ability to use feedback from processes to make necessary adjustment to maintain safe and efficient output.
Work well in a team setting and be able to convey information about the status of reactions to others.
Subject to a production plant environment including noise, vibration, hazards, hot and cold atmospheric conditions and wearing a respirator when required.
Self-motivated and willing to learn in a dynamic fast paced environment.
What We Offer:
Paid company holidays
Vacation and Sick Leave.
401k with 50% company match.
Medical, Dental, Vision, Accident and Critical Illness plans for employee and family.
Company paid Life Insurance, AD&D Insurance, Short Term Disability and Long Term Disability.
Annual Bonus
Student Loan Assistance and Tuition Assistance
Company provided Uniforms, Work Boots and PPE.
Gelest is located in Morrisville, PA and is in close proximity to Interstate 95, Route 1 and the PA/NJ turnpikes.
Minimum 2 years college chemistry required, Bachelor's degree preferred, or equivalent experience
Shiftwork (2nd of 3rd Shift) may be required.
Lifting/Carrying - Frequent lifting of up to and over 50 lbs.
Pushing/Pulling/Climbing – Must be able to push a drum truck, use equipment to tip over drums and climb stairs.
Able to operate or learn to operate a forklift
Walking/Continuous standing
Be aware of fire, safety and chemical hazards. Wear personal protective equipment as needed.
Pass respirator fit test as required by OSHA
Must be able to hear and respond to all communications and alarms
Must be able to read instructions, SDS and interpret packaging codes
May be required to work overtime
Work and communicate well with other departments
Responsible for operating various hand tools and pumps in a safe manner
To function as a member of the safety committee or emergency response team if required
Maintain positive and pleasant attitude with all coworkers.
Responsible for maintaining cleanliness and good working conditions of all work areas
Other duties as determined by management

A well-respected and established innovative corporation is looking to add a Research Chemist to their team. This individual be focused on the development of vaporizing chemicals for organic and conventional horticultural crops in response to innovative technology. The individual in this position will identify potential actives for vaporization and/or volatilization, formulate fungicides, insecticides, and sanitizers for commercialization and determine the ideal conditions within the range of gas compositions and pressure to be used for holding perishables.
Research Chemist Responsibilities:
Carry out vigorous and dynamic research focused on vaporizing single and multicomponent mixtures
Plan, organize and conduct experiments to develop pesticides (fungicides and insecticides) and sanitizers via vaporization and/or volatilization under vacuum.
Execute quality analyses in response to vaporized and/or volatized chemicals.
Monitoring and providing advice to optimize the parameters required for each mixture in concert with the research team.
Design experimental trials in laboratory and commercial scales.
Responsible for identifying, evaluating potential actives and carrier(s) from natural origin and synthetic chemistry.
Ensuring that the research and development activities will draw upon practical knowledge of chemistry to investigate the response to the technology that extend shelf life and quality with the goal of delaying senescence of harvested horticultural crops.
Closely works with engineers, fruit physiologist/pathologist, marketing, and business specialists to support various activities within the company.
Assuming the role as a Project Manager when needed for selected projects, supervising one or more technicians
Research Chemist Requirements:
Ph.D. or M.S. Degree
Strong knowledge of physical and chemical properties, structures, compositions, and/or reactions for potential pesticides (fungicides and insecticides)
Ability to set up a chemistry laboratory with essential equipment
Experience/knowledge of fruit/plant physiology and biochemistry, ripening, and senescence processes of horticultural crops
Adept in applying phase transitions in complex scenarios
Valid U.S. Driver's License
Research Chemist Compensation:
Competitive salary (Depends on Experience)
Excellent healthcare benefits (medical, dental, vision, etc.)

Below is an overview of our benefits and compensation programs: • Medical, including prescription drug benefit, Dental and Vision (start day one of employment with no waiting period) • Retirement Pension Plan • Savings and Investment plan (401k) with eligible company match • Paid vacation and holidays • Disability benefits • Other special programs, i.e., EAP (employee assistance program), wellness, pet benefits, caregiver support benefit, Aflac, Legal Guard, and many others • Comprehensive compensation program

Process Research to Support Production
Demonstrates feasibility of technical solutions to key problems/issues known within research group and project teams.
Responsible for safely setting up and conducting laboratory experiments independently, for properly maintaining Sasol equipment, and for the generation and communication of reliable, properly documented data to project leaders and R&D management.

Key Accountabilities
Acknowledged as a technical resource within research group and frequently consulted by peers
May manage or maintain a variety of equipment within a laboratory.
Initiates research projects that address the technical development objectives of the research group

Within the framework of the overall technical program, plans activities of laboratory support personnel
Leads others within the group or in cross-group team projects
May execute activities of coaching, counseling, budgeting, and reporting
Interacts with supervising scientist or manager and group members, and routinely interacts with other research groups in the local laboratory and other Performance Chemicals locations
Develops and maintains relationships within research group, LC R&D department, and possibly with contacts outside the R&D department, depending upon the domain of the job

Introduction:
Obiter Research, LLC is a chemical research and manufacture company specialized in process chemistry and difficult to achieve chemistry. We have built up our reputation in the chemistry industry by being the dependable, 'last resort' solution for our customers. Our products include all the different monomers for detecting, CBD intermediates, biological drugs intermediates, etc. We have a very energetic, passionate team and eager to grow our team with chemists who share those same qualities and traits.
Job Description:
This position requires an experienced chemist that is able to work both independently and within a team environment on a project with minimal supervision and obtain quality results. Responsibilities include adhering to strict project timelines, maintaining a safe work place and positively collaborating with Research and Production Chemists. The focus is on bench chemistry for both production and research & development for multi-step processes.
Hours:
Full-Time, salaried, (40 - 45 hours/week), Monday – Friday
Requirements:
Must have a PhD in Organic Synthetic Chemistry.
Must be able to work in a multi-cultural team environment.
Demonstrate problem-solving abilities working on multi-step synthesis.
Experienced in multi-step ( >8 steps) synthetic sequences.
Use of standard analytical equipment (e.g. NMR, HPLC, GC).
Experience in milligram – multi-gram ( >100g) reaction scale.
Excellent oral / written communication and presentation skills.
Self-sufficient, driven, and eager to succeed.
Performs routine and non-routine chemical analysis.
Sets up and simultaneously performs multiple laboratory chemical reactions and formulating experiments of various types.
Safety, health and environmental excellence.
Maintenance and operation of laboratory equipment.
Chemistry proposals and development.
Comfortable working in a large scale environment with the use of 200 L reactor, 50 kg centrifuge, 50 kg filters, etc.
Desired Skills:
Experience in milligram-multi-gram ( >100g) reaction.
Experience in process chemistry and process development.
Strong tendency toward collaboration and innovation.
Experience with multi-parallel synthesis is a plus.
Able to perform with minimal written or verbal instructions in a timely and efficient manner.
Multi task in a fast-paced environment
