RESEARCH SCIENTIST II, CHEMICAL DEVELOPMENT
Position Summary:
Global Blood Therapeutics, Inc. (GBT) is seeking a Research Scientist II in Chemical Development who will be responsible for the process chemistry and scale up activities related to the clinical development and manufacturing of small molecule programs. GBT places a high value on cooperative team dynamics and a positive, "can-do" work ethic. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment where a strong sense of urgency is the norm and exceptional communication and interpersonal skills are needed.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Design and execute synthetic sequences with the intent for optimization and scale up
Present results of experiments, independently interpret data, and draw conclusions regarding results of laboratory work
Work on complex problems where analysis of situations or data require comprehensive evaluation of many factors
Provide technical support to drug substance development, including impurity control strategies and process route development
Demonstrate skills in data analysis (ex: UPLC, HPLC, NMR, mass spec) and ability to evaluate quality of data
Accountable to summarize studies, generate, review and approve necessary reports to provide scientifically sound and data-based support of chemical development
Apply relevant regulatory guidance (cGMPs, ICH, CFR) in daily work and work planning
Up to 20% travel may be needed for scientific project management and monitoring of critical project activities
Qualifications:
PhD in synthetic organic chemistry, or BS/MS in chemistry with extensive industrial process chemistry experience
Chemical development experience with synthesis and crystallizations of heterocycles and chiral molecules preferred
Sensitive to timelines and solution oriented
Familiar with cGMPs, USP and ICH guidelines and industry best practices
A strong chemist who leads with data and understands the requirements for process development and GMP manufacturing
Familiarity with physical and chemical characterization of drug substances and drug substance intermediates
Excellent written and verbal communications skills required
Comfort working in multi-disciplinary teams, learning new skills and proactively solving problems
Fit with GBT culture:
Ability to build strong relationships with co-workers of various backgrounds and expertise
Ability to function at a high level in a team setting whether leading the group or acting as an individual contributor
Values-based leadership consistent with GBT's Core Values
Excitement about the vision and mission of GBT
Flexibility
Integrity

Company Name: Proteogenomics Research Institute for Systems Medicine
Job Description:
General Description:
The Proteogenomics Research Institute for Systems Medicine (PRISM) is a biomedical research institute leading the way in development of novel treatments for cancer. PRISM is currently seeking a highly motivated, detail oriented, well organized research scientist with skills in bioconjugation chemistry to participate in development of antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs) with different linker chemistry. The individual will be a critical part of our studies, supporting preclinical development of immunotargeted agents for cancer treatment.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
The successful candidate will primarily focus on the ADC development and production - bioconjugations, optimization and analytical characterization of antibody drug conjugations for therapeutic studies. The candidate is expected to work in a highly collaborative fast-paced environment, to be self-motivated, well-organized and capable of working independently.
Qualifications/Experience/Skills:
PhD degree in organic chemistry, biochemistry or related is preferred. M.S. with equivalent experience will be considered.
Expertise in synthetic organic chemistry and/or biochemistry, with > 3 years of post-graduate experience in areas of protein bioconjugations. Experience in field of antibody-drug conjugates or nanomedicines/nanotechnology is highly desirable.
Deep understanding of bioconjugation chemistry principles particularly conjugation of small molecules to proteins is highly desirable.
Familiarity with operation of HPLC instruments is required.
Experience with analytical techniques such as ESI, LC/MS, NMR, MALDI/TOF MS, and UV/VIS spectrophotometry.
Maintain detailed experimental records in electronic and hardcopy formats, and prepare presentations.
Ability to learn new skills quickly and demonstrate initiative and follow-through in problem-solving.
Detail oriented, highly organized, and the ability to work with minimal supervision.
Must be proactive, co-operative, and willing to work in a fast-paced small team environment.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Desirable Qualifications:
Background in techniques of bioconjugational chemistry using different linkers, particularly for attachment of therapeutic drugs to antibodies to generate ADCs. While not essential, experience with in vitro cell cytotoxicity assays and ELISA would be plus.

600. That's the number of chemists globally at the Novartis Institutes for Biomedical Research (NIBR) who will be your colleagues, collaborators, mentors, and guides in the creation of new medicines. The Global Discovery Chemistry Department (GDC) working across seven disease areas at NIBR, is seeking a motivated chemist to join our team in Cambridge, MA.

Here, we value your ideas, professional development, and career aspirations. You will collaborate with and learn from curious colleagues across multiple scientific subject areas; you will have opportunities to explore the power of innovative science and technology; you will be empowered to take sensible risks, and to use your creativity and resourcefulness to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.

We are looking for individuals with expertise in chemical science and scientific leadership skills. Successful candidates are:

1. Insightful, collaborative, and decisive project contributors

2. Driven by the goal to create new medicines with urgency

3. Creative and curious lab-based scientists

4. Dynamic individuals with high learning agility

Your responsibilities include:

Contributing at all stages of the drug discovery process, from project inception to early development.

Applying experience and innovative methods to solve challenges in compound synthesis and diversification; advising other chemists locally and globally on matters of organic chemistry.

Working closely with other experts in multi-disciplinary teams, you will identify key drug discovery issues, propose and implement creative solutions, execute on innovative medicinal chemistry designs, and guide teams to success and decision points.

Developing leadership skills to help drive project strategy, and providing insightful guidance to tackle medicinal chemistry problems.



What you will bring to the role:

a PhD in organic chemistry with 0-3 years of industrial experience, or a BS/MS with equivalent related experience.

A record of scientific achievement from the lab exemplified by peer-reviewed publications, conference presentations, and/or patent inventorship.

Strong laboratory presence and experience mentoring scientists.

Outstanding communication skills

A natural curiosity and desire for learning and growth

Why Novartis?

766 million lives were touched by Novartis medicines in 2021, and while we’re proud of this, we know there is so much more we could do to help improve and extend people’s lives.

We believe new insights, perspectives and ground-breaking solutions can be found at the intersection of medical science and digital innovation. That a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment inspires new ways of working.

We believe our potential can thrive and grow in an unbossed culture underpinned by integrity, curiosity and flexibility. And we can reinvent what's possible, when we collaborate with courage to aggressively and ambitiously tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges. Because the greatest risk in life, is the risk of never trying!

Imagine what you could do here at Novartis!

JOB DESCRIPTION
Job Title:
Analytical Chemist
Job Purpose:
Provide high-level analytical chemistry expertise to the company. Lead scientist for the laboratory’s operation and associated instrumentation. Serve as a back-up to the
Laboratory Director.
Job Duties:
Reporting to the Laboratory Director, the Analytical Chemist is responsible for all aspects of the laboratory including operation, maintenance, troubleshooting, data collection and analysis, and reporting/presenting of chemical and analytical output.
Devise technically competent test methods and study protocols, execute the studies, and create clear, concise reports in a timely manner.
Develop chromatographic and mass spectral methods for current and emerging business opportunities, e.g., development of acid hydrolysis (e.g., HCl, HF,
HNO3) microwave digestion methods for ICP-MS sample preparation.
Communicate as needed with clients to clarify requirements
Keep UPLC/MS, ICP-MS, and GC/MS instrumentation operational for successful daily use by maintaining laboratory supplies and performing routine maintenance and weekly surveillance.
Handle a range of organic chemical sample preparations, syntheses, and polymerizations utilizing organic solvents (e.g., tetrahydrofuran, acetonitrile, toluene, methylene chloride) and monomers (methyl methacrylate, other acrylate monomers).
Perform physical duties such as routine instrumentation maintenance, e.g., replace vacuum pump oil, interchange compressed gas cylinders and dewars, maintain solvent supplies for analytical equipment.
Travel as required for training, conference booth attendance, and client meetings.
Support the maintenance and promotion of the InVision Biomedical Quality
System and Quality Objectives
Skills/Qualifications:
Demonstrated ability to define an analytical problem, devise the program to solve problem, and execute the program to completion.
Strong oral and written communication skills. Must be fluent in English.
Good computer skills including Word, Excel, and instrument software.

Essential is a privately owned company that sells its ability to help companies create their next-generation coatings. We expect to deliver our customers a WOW experience when working with us. We believe in the challenge of problem-solving and that learning from our mistakes is more powerful than learning from our successes. We find it fun to discover new solutions, invent new polymers and technologies, and work with our customers to find new and creative ways to solve their problems.
Job Profile:
Join our R&D polymer team at Essential Industries as a Chemist I.
This team member will be responsible for developing new water-based acrylic emulsion polymers and polyurethane dispersions to fit the customer's needs. They will be responsible for developing the polymer and evaluating its performance in a starting point formulation. They will also be responsible to work with the process engineers and chemical operators to scale up the formulations from lab to pilot to full production.
Key Responsibilities
Assist in the analysis of all Essential’s products, intermediates, and raw materials to ensure they meet specifications and customer requirements.
Ensure all required QC tests are performed in coordination with the production schedule.
Assist in the data entry of the Quality Control results.
Operate and maintain QC instrumentation in a safe and professional manner.
Assist in developing polymers for the coatings industries.
Assist in formulating the polymers into a coatings formulation and then perform the appropriate physical testing and report the results.
Qualifications and Skills:
BA, BS in Polymer Chemistry, Organic Chemistry or related field.
0-3 years experience in emulsion polymerization, polyurethane dispersions or a closely related field.
Effective communication with internal teams, as well as with customers.
Understanding and the use of Design of Experiments is a plus.
Ability to perform intermediate mathematical calculations, such as stoichiometry.
Microsoft Office experience
Having a passion to solve problems by developing new and innovative solutions.
Physical Requirements:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. This requires the ability to lift, move bend, and stand, as well as lift 20+ lbs as necessary.

Evaluate materials by odor.

Job description
POSITION DETAILS:
Spectrix Analytical Services, LLC is seeking highly motivated individual to fill a full time position performing routine small molecule purification using a variety of automated prep chromatography methods. The positions will be located at our client’s biopharmaceutical research facility in San Diego, CA.
Under the direction of the laboratory manager, the Purification Scientist will analyze incoming crude novel compounds (5-100 mg) from medicinal chemists by UPLC/MS, develop and implement purification methods, and isolate the purified products by analytical UPLC/MS. The Purification Scientist will also help maintain and troubleshoot instruments, perform routine laboratory process and maintenance tasks, and communicate results to customers.
EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:
Selected candidates will be required to
Possess a minimum of a B.S. degree in chemistry, biochemistry, or other physical science with 2-5 years of industrial laboratory experience or a M.S. degree in a similar field. This is not a doctorate level position.
Have a college level understanding of organic chemistry and instrumental analysis including UV/Vis, chromatography and mass spectrometry.
Possess excellent written and oral communication skills.
Work collaboratively in a team oriented environment, interacting with a variety of departments.
Follow all laboratory and workplace safety requirements.
Demonstrate excellent customer service.
The ideal candidate will also have
Laboratory experience outside of those associated with class work (internship, co-op, independent project) preferably in organic or analytical chemistry.
Hands on experience with HPLC, and LC/MS.
Hand on experience with SFC, preferred.
Strong instrument operating skills and computer proficiency.
Spectrix offers flexible schedules, competitive salaries, and a committed work environment to its employees; the company provides automatic benefits of life insurance and short and long term disability insurance. Optional benefits for full time employees include health, dental, and vision insurance, college loan assistance, and an employer matched retirement savings plan. Spectrix is not a placement agency. Spectrix is participating in the E-Verify program of the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (phone number: 888-897-7781, and website: www.dhs.gov/E-Verify).

Job Description
Vertex Pharmaceuticals has an exciting opportunity for a research scientist in the field of medicinal chemistry. Job responsibilities include the preparation of both single and focused sets of small organic molecules, developing and optimizing synthetic methods, creating and interpreting project-relevant Structure-Activity Relationship (SAR) and problem solving. Candidates must demonstrate an expert understanding of organic reaction mechanisms, formulation of executable synthetic routes, up to date understanding of contemporary synthetic methods as well as an ability to balance rational concepts with creativity which includes the development of new synthetic methodology as needed. The successful candidate will have the ability to work independently and be able to multi-task collaboratively in teams while adapting to rapidly changing needs. A strong desire to grow as a medicinal chemist while maintaining a passion for organic chemistry and the courage to challenge conventional wisdom are essential in this role.
Key Responsibilities:
Maintain a high level of productivity in the laboratory setting
Develops and executes clear synthetic routes using state-of-the-art synthetic methodologies
Primarily responsible for executing organic syntheses in a timely, efficient, and independent manner
Create and interpret SAR with a clear understanding of the biological data
Organize and triage efforts to stay consistent with project priorities
Clearly and effectively communicate ideas and results (both verbally and in writing) to a broad range of audiences
Knowledge and Skills:
Designs and executes complex, challenging chemistry experiments
Demonstrates astute understanding of his/her own discipline and the relevant literature
Maintains a high level of knowledge related to current developments in the scientiﬁc Project ﬁeld
Displays proven productivity and experimental creativity, and effective dissemination of ideas
Demonstrates effective, self-sufﬁcient communication skills, especially in peer-directed presentations
Demonstrates awareness of other project-related disciplines and an understanding of general concepts and some experimental detail within those areas
Education and Experience:
Ph.D. (or equivalent degree) in chemistry or related science 0-3 years of relevant post-doctoral employment experience, or
Master’s degree (or equivalent degree) in chemistry or related science and 3+ years of relevant employment experience, or
Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent degree) in chemistry or related science and 6+ years of relevant employment experience
Demonstrated effective communication skills, both verbal and written
Ability to navigate and be successful in a fast-paced, highly matrixed work environment
A desire to be part of a highly innovative company aimed at transforming the lives of people with serious diseases, their families and society
Company Information
Vertex is a global biotechnology company that invests in scientific innovation.
Vertex is committed to equal employment opportunity and non-discrimination for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to a person's race, color, sex, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, marital status, or any characteristic protected under applicable law. Vertex is an E-Verify Employer in the United States. Vertex will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.
Please note that Vertex requires COVID-19 vaccination for all employees working in the U.S. as a condition of employment at Vertex, subject to medical, religious or other accommodations or exemptions required by law. Job Title: Associate Chemist for the Toxicology Lab
Job Description:
Are you an experienced Medical Lab Professional? Are you looking to embark on a new challenge in your career, or start your career in Medical Lab Science? If so, LabCorp wants to speak with you about exciting opportunities to join our team as an Associate Chemist in the Toxicology department in Burlington, NC. In this position you will work in a fast paced, customer focused, and challenging environment, and will be a part of our overall mission at LabCorp: "Improving Health, Improving Lives".
The Toxicology department consists of 4 sub departments: Toxicology, Biological Monitoring, Blood Lead and Mass Spectrometry. These have a combined volume of approximately 500,00 tests a month. Our toxicology tests are primarily focused on therapeutic drug monitoring, our biological monitoring tests focus on metal or chemical exposures and our mass spec department is our most rapidly growing area and encompasses testing from several disciplines from toxicology to endocrinology. The Toxicology department offers experience with many types of analytical instrumentation such as GC, GC/MS, HPLC, ICP/MS and LC/MS/MS as well as with automated and manual systems of sample preparation. Position is in the LC/MS Data Review/Operator Section of Toxicology. Position will be responsible for reviewing and certifying LC/MS data utilizing Analyst and Ascent software.

Performs minor troubleshooting/repair and instrument prep of LC/MS systems
Gains knowledge of department operations and procedures under direct supervision and in an entry-level capacity.
Conducts qualitative and quantitative analyses on organic and inorganic samples to determine their chemical properties.
Participates in development of new analytical procedures.
Gains knowledge of department operations and procedures.
Requirements:
Bachelor's Science in Biology, Chemistry, Medical Technology or related Life Science.
Must have at least 3 years of clinical laboratory experience with preference given for Chromatographic Data Review experience.
Attention to detail.
Knowledge of automated and manual systems of sample preparation.

A quickly growing clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company is looking for a Principal Scientist from Discovery Chemist to support drug development projects, focused on oncology, immunology, and dermatology. This position offers a very challenging and rewarding work environment, within a thriving company. Candidates will be given the opportunity to participate in projects of increasing complexity and need a demonstrated expertise in synthetic organic chemistry applied in
the fields of bioconjugation, biomacromolecules, or chemical biology.

Synthesize bioconjugates using established (e,g, lysine-NHS, cysteine-maleimide) chemistries and contribute to the development of new methodology

Direct the development and validation of bioanalytical methods

Medicinal Chemistry – Associate Director
We are seeking a talented and highly motivated individual with a strong background in medicinal chemistry to join our Small Molecule Drug Discovery team.
The successful candidate will lead a team of medicinal chemists and engage in rational design of new agents for the potential treatment in cardiovascular disease. The individual will apply modern drug design principles including machine learning approaches to solve medicinal chemistry problems relevant to the cardiovascular discovery portfolio. Furthermore, you will collaborate with a broad group of scientists within BMS to advance the projects from inception to IND enabling studies. Knowledge and experience in cardiovascular diseases or genetic based diseases is a plus. The successful chemist will interface with an excellent team of scientists in biology, biochemistry, structural biology, computational sciences and translational development.

Job Title: Research Associate I - Synthetic Chemistry
Reports To: Research Chemist
Employment Status: Full-Time
Employment Type: Hourly/Non-Exempt
About IMCS:
At Integrated Micro-Chromatography Systems (IMCS), we develop novel technologies and products to address the growing needs of clinical and research laboratories to increase testing efficiencies. IMCS products help to pave the way for the future of precision medicine.
IMCSzyme® was the first recombinant enzyme product in urine drug testing that did not alter heroin metabolite detection. As such, we understand the importance of accuracy, which is why we are committed to delivering products that consistently provide fast, reliable results.
Job Summary:
IMCS seeks an enthusiastic entry level associate for its glycoscience program who demonstrates a strong interest in organic synthesis. Primary responsibilities will focus on assisting chemist on synthesis and analysis of small molecules which include enzyme substrates, mono and di-saccharides, glycopeptides, and glycosides. The candidate will actively work with supervising chemist to advance the chemoenzymatic synthesis of glycan containing molecules such as gangliosides, cerebrosides, sphingosines, glycosides, and other complex glycans. The person in this role will be trained with a range of experimental methods common to synthetic and analytical chemistry and biochemistry. Once familiar with the laboratory techniques, s/he will be expected to execute assigned experimental work in a timely manner.
Candidate will participate in research projects based on detailed descriptions and conversations with supervisor. Candidate will analyze raw data by methods provided, confirm the accuracy and precision of the work, and assist in the interpretation of results. Candidate must communicate effectively with supervisors and peers, both verbally (in meeting situations) and in written documents and reports. Candidate must learn, know, and observe all safety standards. Candidate must adhere to all safety standards, company policies, including work hours, dress code, and Paid Time Off schedules.
Responsibilities (may include but not limited to):
Perform laboratory experiments and record results;
Report status of assigned projects through the preparation of detailed reports and documentation that summarize experiment results. Interprets results of experiments and makes recommendations for improvements;
Contribute to ongoing development projects in a fast-paced research environment using a product development process;
Adhere to protocols for molecule synthesis in the milligram and gram scales.
Collection and analysis of analytical and performance data, both for individual contributions as well as synthesis team support;
Execute synthesis conditions to achieve commercial levels of stability, robustness, and performance;
Keep detailed lab notebooks, prepare reports, updates and summaries for team leader as directed.
Required Qualifications (knowledge AND experience):
B.Sc. in Chemistry, Organic Chemistry, or related field and 0+ years relevant work experience.
Preferred Qualifications (knowledge OR experience):
Laboratory experience in organic or synthetic chemistry;
Different chemical reactions (protection/deprotection, carbon-carbon coupling, non- enzymatic glycosylation, anaerobic/anhydrous);
Knowledge of equipment (U)HPLC; FPLC; liquid chromatography; crystallization; distillation; NMR; mass spectrometry; FTIR;
Prior research and experience in carbohydrate chemistry;
Demonstrate strong interpersonal relationships with examples of successful collaborations with third parties;
Prior work experience in protein conjugations and chemoenzymatic chemistries.
Physical Demands and Work Environment
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be performed by an employee to successfully execute the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these functions.
While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk and or listen.
The employee must be able to sit for extended periods. The employee is frequently required to use hands and fingers, handle or feel objects, utilize tools, and operate controls. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, sit, and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus. The noise level in the work environment is typically low to moderate.
Note
This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee(s) incumbent in this position. Employees will be required to follow any other job- related instructions and perform any other job-related duties requested by any person authorized to give instructions or assignments. All duties and responsibilities are essential functions and requirements of this position and are subject to modification for reasonable accommodation of individuals with disabilities. To perform this job successfully, the incumbents must possess the skills, aptitudes, and abilities to perform each duty proficiently. Some requirements may exclude individuals who pose a direct threat or significant risk to the health or safety of themselves or others. The requirements listed in this document are the minimum levels of knowledge, skills, and abilities. This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an “at will” relationship.

Our organization is focused on delivering transformative technology solutions for applications across multiple categories/businesses/sectors. We are seeking a highly motivated Associate Scientist Chemist to develop technologies and formulations that transform or disrupt existing methods of hygiene across P&G categories. These technologies are designed for multi-GBU applications and present the opportunity for entrepreneurial candidates to identify new opportunities to grow P&G’s business through disruptive innovation. This individual can work on highly complex and uncertain projects, can build new ways of thinking, and interact and influence internally across the Company.
In this role, you will develop and leverage technical mastery in both chemistry and biology to deliver disruptive technologies and holistic product propositions. This role will also require effective partnership across the functions of R&D to develop and deliver holistic product propositions utilizing your innovations. Specific responsibilities include:
Design and execute detailed technical learning plans and work in concert with platform team members to ensure coherent and focused progress against well-defined technical goals.
Regularly assess technology leads and make recommendations on whether to transfer to the business, continue further development, or discontinue further activity.
Contribute to creative and robust IP strategies to protect emerging inventions.
Integrate technical mastery with in-lab experimentation and learning to co-create and deliver holistic product propositions with internal partners.

Qualifications

We are looking for someone with a Bachelor’s or Master degree in the field of Chemistry.
Technical Mastery – Strong understanding of chemistry (organic, synthetic, physical) is required (BS/MS in a chemistry discipline, preferably with some knowledge of biochemistry or biology), including mastery of laboratory techniques, data collection, and interpretation. Have knowledge and experience in product formulation as well as rapid prototyping to quickly test technology ideas.
Technical Leadership – Be responsible for leading the design and execution of technical learning plans in support of the project direction and strategies. Capable of determining priorities, defining the work, and delivering against the business and R&D/project/program objectives.
Grows Capability – Be responsible for growing and developing disruptive technology platforms. Identifying the best suited instrumental measures, development of elegant methodologies and technical models, and coaching and technical growth within the group is crucial. Experience managing technology transitions from upstream to downstream is critical. Effectively coaching and partnering with others in a diverse and inclusive learning culture is required.
Builds, Diverse, Collaborative Relationships – Collaboration will be a key skill for this individual to demonstrate. Our organization resides at the interface of multiple technical functions. Have a proven track record of working effectively within a broader team and R&D organization to accomplish project objectives and will have demonstrated expertise in leveraging technical skills to identify the most suitable transformative technology solutions and bring these to market in partnership with downstream colleagues.
In Touch – Be in touch both internally and externally, through personal connections and understanding of the academic and IP literature. Ability to use external university and supplier relationships as well as the scientific, technical, and patent literature to develop the technology and formulation options. Ability to develop transformative technology solutions relative to incumbent internal and external technologies and products is essential.
Operates with Discipline – Our work involves multiple organizations and customers that have different timelines and priorities. The successful candidate will demonstrate the ability to focus the learning plan against the critical issues in the project. Excellence in execution, balancing multiple priorities, and delivering on commitments are essential.
What we offer:
Responsibilities as of Day 1 – you will feel the ownership of your project from the beginning, and you will be given specific projects and responsibilities.
Continuous mentorship – you will work with passionate people and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager.
Work and be part of a dynamic and encouraging environment - working over a diverse array of interesting problems.
Promote agility and work/life balance for employees, we value every individual and support initiatives.
Experience true support for work/life effectiveness and your long-term well-being.
Get a competitive salary and benefits' package.

About Turning Point Therapeutics:
Turning Point is a growing clinical-stage precision oncology company with a pipeline of internally discovered investigational drugs designed to address key limitations of existing cancer therapies. The company is driven to develop therapies that mark a turning point for patients in their cancer treatment. We are applying novel small molecule design approaches integrating tumor biology and structure-based drug design to develop a new generation of proprietary targeted agents that we believe will have the potential to address important unmet medical needs for patients.

Our vision, mission, and culture underpin everything we do. Turning Point's vision is to be the leader in precision oncology. Our mission is to bring differentiated therapies to patients with cancer as rapidly as possible. Turning Point's culture unifies our team and is rooted in four core values:

Human Centric. Our work revolves around the patients we aim to serve, as well as the team members we innovate alongside. We relentlessly pursue new therapies, all with the intent to improve the lives of people with cancer.
Speed Where it Matters. We make decisions thoughtfully and quickly without sacrificing quality or integrity. Our team works with a sense of urgency to achieve its goals. We are dynamic with a purpose.
Extreme Team. We build strong relationships based on transparency and open communication. Determined but humble, we combine hard work and fun to achieve the extraordinary.
Resilience. Adaptive and nimble, we boldly embrace and drive change to continually evolve. We are continuous learners, recognizing challenges as opportunities to creatively solve problems.
The opportunity:
We are seeking an exceptional synthetic organic chemist to join our Medicinal Chemistry team as a Scientist or Senior Scientist, depending on experience. The candidate will have strong synthetic organic skills, extensive working knowledge of modern synthetic methods, and be motivated to advance the discovery of new cancer therapies as part of an extremely team focused organization. We're looking for scientists with excellent learning agility and innovative problem-solving ability who can independently drive for results and partner with internal and external teams to advance projects. We empower our scientists and have a strong culture of mentorship and cross-functional collaboration. As a Scientist or Senior Scientist is our group you will be a key contributor to the design of molecules and chemical strategies.
We apply a cutting-edge design methodology anchored by deep SBDD expertise coupled with a disciplined chemistry approach and enabling biology expertise to build upon our early portfolio. Our research organization has the exciting tasks of discovering new investigational molecules and identifying additional clinical opportunities for our existing clinical assets.
The successful candidate will bring broad insights of chemistry to design and synthesize small molecules, develop new synthetic routes, and partner with both internal and external chemistry teams to advance the projects and solve chemistry problems. Importantly, they will partner with computational chemists, crystallographers, and biologists as a key member of our essential structure-based design team.
The position demands strong people and communication skills, a can-do-now attitude, and the ability embrace our fast-paced team environment.
What you will do:
Serve as a scientific expert in synthetic organic chemistry with both internal and external partners.
Formulate hypotheses to advance projects and design molecules to efficiently test these hypotheses
As a key member of the design team for multiple projects you will apply medicinal chemistry expertise including structure-based drug design (SBDD) and physiochemical property optimization to design compounds for the internal and external synthesis.
Independently and collaboratively apply cutting-edge synthetic approaches to design and execute the efficient syntheses of drug-like target molecules to advance our drug discovery projects.
Work collaboratively with partners across multiple disciplines within Turning Point and our CRO's.
Utilize structure-based design principles to positively impact rational design of molecules while operating in high-probability drug-like space.
Generate novel, testable hypotheses to support our drug discovery portfolio.
Ensure optimal interaction/communication and provide updates on chemistry status to stakeholders.
Prepare and present work summaries for department and project meetings.
We'd love to hear from you if:
You have a Ph.D. in Chemistry or related scientific discipline, or M.S. in Chemistry or related discipline with 6+ years of related experience, or B.S. in Chemistry with 8+ years of relevant experience.
You have Postdoctoral experience.
You bring expert skills and knowledge of modern synthetic chemistry methods.
You have strong problem-solving skills for developing creative, innovative solutions, and meeting project objectives.
You have scientific creativity, independent critical thought, and crisp decision-making ability.
You have outstanding written, verbal, and presentations skills.
You bring a strong track record of success in synthetic method development or the synthesis of complex molecules.
You have a demonstrated track record of scientific contributions including peer reviewed publications.
Benefits with you in mind:

Turning Point cares about each team member and their wellbeing. We take great pride in cultivating an outstanding employee experience where team members thrive and do their best work. For full-time employees, we offer competitive salaries, bonuses, and equity incentives. Full-time employees also enjoy competitive benefit options, including medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. We also offer full-time team members an HSA with a generous employer contribution, as well as healthcare and dependent care FSAs. Turning Point supports employee retirement goals with a group 401K plan that includes an excellent company match. We know that time with family and personal time to recharge is important, and that's why we offer full-time employees paid company holidays, a winter holiday season shutdown, vacation, and sick time. Full-time employees also have generous leave programs, employee referral bonuses and onsite perks such as a subsidized lunch delivery service, gym access, and a stocked kitchen made available during office hours.

We're better together:
At Turning Point, we are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive working environment. When we say 'diverse,' we mean it in all senses of the word: not only in race, gender, ethnicity, age and orientation, but also in our interests, drivers and passion points. We believe our individual differences and perspectives are what make us stronger as a team and unite us in our purpose. (GBT) is seeking a Research Scientist II in Chemical Development who will be responsible for the process chemistry and scale up activities related to the clinical development and manufacturing of small molecule programs. A strong chemist who leads with data and understands the requirements for process development and GMP manufacturing

Excellent written and verbal communications skills required

Fit with GBT culture:
Ability to build strong relationships with co-workers of various backgrounds and expertise
Ability to function at a high level in a team setting whether leading the group or acting as an individual contributor
Values-based leadership consistent with GBT's Core Values
Excitement about the vision and mission of GBT
Flexibility

Chemist I
Precision Analytical (PA), creators of the DUTCH Test, is looking for a Chemist I to help support our company growth and further our mission of providing the best diagnostic tools in functional medicine. PA is an exciting place to develop your skills, take care of client needs, and be a part of a dynamic team.
This position offers career progression within our lab team and entry level candidates are welcomed! Successful candidates will have the ability to learn quickly and effectively, have a passion for quality and an interest in helping others.
This role will work onsite in our McMinnville, OR location.
We care about your time and interest to know next steps in our recruitment process. To show this, all applicants will receive a personalized response within 3 business days.
Job Summary:
You will be responsible for performing high quality analytical methods in a progressive laboratory. You will provide support for lab analysis through routine sample testing and basic instrument troubleshooting.
Responsibilities:
Perform analytical methods on patient samples (urine and saliva samples) using UV-vis spectrophotometry, solid phase extractions, hydrolysis and derivatization to prepare samples for instrument analysis
Prepare standards or reagents needed for analytical procedures
Regularly observe equipment for any abnormalities, perform basic troubleshooting and maintenance of associated equipment
Effectively multitask and coordinate multiple assignments simultaneously with a high degree of accuracy and timeliness
Maintain and follow all laboratory methods, protocols, and SOPs; follow other company procedures, guidelines, and policies
Communicate effectively and with a sense of urgency quality issues or key findings to the proper supervisor
Adhere to safety and housekeeping requirements, and communicate concerns to supervisor or manager
Perform basic office tasks such organizing, filing, copying, emails
Demonstrate PA’s Core Values in daily activities and interactions with others
Collaboratively perform other duties as needed to support company goals
Qualifications:
A Bachelor’s degree with a major in Chemistry, OR equivalent education to include 8 hours of organic chemistry and 4 hours of analytical chemistry, OR analytical chemistry experience through employment
Computer technology experience and the ability to learn systems quickly and effectively; Precision Analytical uses Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, Teams) as well as lab specific systems
Excellent organizational skills, ability to prioritize multiple responsibilities and strong attention to detail
Strong interpersonal and listening skills; the ability to communicate (verbal/writing) effectively at all levels and with all customers, internally and externally
Dependable and punctual; ability to work flexible hours. 90-day training period is Monday through Friday ( 8 hour days, some overtime may be required). After training, this position will be required to work a 4-day, 10-hour schedule Sunday-Wednesday or Wednesday-Saturday determined by company needs.
Positive teamwork-oriented attitude; champion for our people, culture, company, and brand
Work environment:
This position is located in an office/lab environment with frequent use of laboratory instruments and tools, computer and related hardware. A person must be able to stand and/or sit and effectively move around the building and lab workspaces; see, hear and talk; use hands to type, handle or feel tools or controls; use hands and arms to reach.
This position requires lifting up to 25lbs, and use of PPE when working with urine, saliva, or other samples, or with chemicals and other substances, within our lab environment.

Company Name: Proteogenomics Research Institute for Systems Medicine
Job Description:
General Description:
The Proteogenomics Research Institute for Systems Medicine (PRISM) is a biomedical research institute leading the way in development of novel treatments for cancer. PRISM is currently seeking a highly motivated, detail oriented, well organized research scientist with skills in bioconjugation chemistry to participate in development of antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs) with different linker chemistry. The individual will be a critical part of our studies, supporting preclinical development of immunotargeted agents for cancer treatment.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
The successful candidate will primarily focus on the ADC development and production - bioconjugations, optimization and analytical characterization of antibody drug conjugations for therapeutic studies. The candidate is expected to work in a highly collaborative fast-paced environment, to be self-motivated, well-organized and capable of working independently.
Qualifications/Experience/Skills:
PhD degree in organic chemistry, biochemistry or related is preferred. M.S. with equivalent experience will be considered.
Expertise in synthetic organic chemistry and/or biochemistry, with > 3 years of post-graduate experience in areas of protein bioconjugations. Experience in field of antibody-drug conjugates or nanomedicines/nanotechnology is highly desirable.
Deep understanding of bioconjugation chemistry principles particularly conjugation of small molecules to proteins is highly desirable.
Familiarity with operation of HPLC instruments is required.
Experience with analytical techniques such as ESI, LC/MS, NMR, MALDI/TOF MS, and UV/VIS spectrophotometry.
Maintain detailed experimental records in electronic and hardcopy formats, and prepare presentations.
Ability to learn new skills quickly and demonstrate initiative and follow-through in problem-solving.
Detail oriented, highly organized, and the ability to work with minimal supervision.
Must be proactive, co-operative, and willing to work in a fast-paced small team environment.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Desirable Qualifications:
Background in techniques of bioconjugational chemistry using different linkers, particularly for attachment of therapeutic drugs to antibodies to generate ADCs. While not essential, experience with in vitro cell cytotoxicity assays and ELISA would be plus.

600. That's the number of chemists globally at the Novartis Institutes for Biomedical Research (NIBR) who will be your colleagues, collaborators, mentors, and guides in the creation of new medicines. The Global Discovery Chemistry Department (GDC) working across seven disease areas at NIBR, is seeking a motivated chemist to join our team in Cambridge, MA.

Here, we value your ideas, professional development, and career aspirations. You will collaborate with and learn from curious colleagues across multiple scientific subject areas; you will have opportunities to explore the power of innovative science and technology; you will be empowered to take sensible risks, and to use your creativity and resourcefulness to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.

We are looking for individuals with expertise in chemical science and scientific leadership skills. Successful candidates are:

1. Insightful, collaborative, and decisive project contributors

2. Driven by the goal to create new medicines with urgency

3. Creative and curious lab-based scientists

4. Dynamic individuals with high learning agility

Your responsibilities include:

Contributing at all stages of the drug discovery process, from project inception to early development.

Applying experience and innovative methods to solve challenges in compound synthesis and diversification; advising other chemists locally and globally on matters of organic chemistry.

Working closely with other experts in multi-disciplinary teams, you will identify key drug discovery issues, propose and implement creative solutions, execute on innovative medicinal chemistry designs, and guide teams to success and decision points.

Developing leadership skills to help drive project strategy, and providing insightful guidance to tackle medicinal chemistry problems.



What you will bring to the role:

a PhD in organic chemistry with 0-3 years of industrial experience, or a BS/MS with equivalent related experience.

A record of scientific achievement from the lab exemplified by peer-reviewed publications, conference presentations, and/or patent inventorship.

Strong laboratory presence and experience mentoring scientists.

Outstanding communication skills

A natural curiosity and desire for learning and growth

Why Novartis?

766 million lives were touched by Novartis medicines in 2021, and while we’re proud of this, we know there is so much more we could do to help improve and extend people’s lives.

We believe new insights, perspectives and ground-breaking solutions can be found at the intersection of medical science and digital innovation. That a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment inspires new ways of working.

We believe our potential can thrive and grow in an unbossed culture underpinned by integrity, curiosity and flexibility. And we can reinvent what's possible, when we collaborate with courage to aggressively and ambitiously tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges. Because the greatest risk in life, is the risk of never trying!

Imagine what you could do here at Novartis!

Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:

Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.

Please include the job requisition number in your message.

While Novartis does not require vaccination at this time, for certain Novartis sites in the US all associates and candidates may be required to either upload an image of their COVID-19 vaccine card demonstrating proof of full vaccination for COVID-19 (or other similar evidence of vaccination) or proof of a negative COVID-19 test taken by the associate or candidate within the past seven days to enter any of our sites and/or customer office or healthcare facility, as well as prior to participating in other work related off-site meetings. Employees working in customer-facing roles must adhere to and comply with customers’ (such as hospitals, physician offices, etc.) credentialing guidelines, which may require vaccination. As required by applicable law, Novartis will consider requests for reasonable accommodation for those unable to be vaccinated. This requirement is subject to applicable state and local laws and may not be applicable to employees working in certain jurisdictions. We are looking for an R&D Chemist to join the R&D Department within Wiley Companies who will be engaged in the laboratory-scale synthesis of custom chemicals/nutrition and health products and the development of commercial processes. The R&D Chemist provides technical support involving the synthesis of custom chemicals, chemical analysis, and technical aspects of the company’s production processes and the development of new products. They will be involved with kilo-lab scale and pilot plant facilities, provide support for technology transfer to production facilities, design, enable and develop scalable processes, apply innovative chemistries, and new technologies and statistical experimental design approaches in a laboratory setting. This individual must have the ability to work on and lead multi-disciplinary teams involving chemists, analysts, and engineers, and be able to represent R&D on cross-functional teams. The R&D Chemist will be the primary investigator/project leader and serve as contact with the internal and external company customers, provide project updates, and chair meetings while also participating in key initiatives for R&D and contribute to continuous improvement work in the department.
Skills and Abilities:
M.S./Ph.D. in synthetic Organic Chemistry or equivalent experience.
Experience in a contract research organization (CRO) or contract manufacturing organization (CMO) environment is desirable.
5+ years of experience in process development for scale up of intermediates and final products from R&D lab to Kilo lab/pilot plant facilities.
Industrial experience in laboratory synthesis of and safe handling of organic, inorganic, and organometallic compounds, catalysts, and polymeric materials.
Collaboration with scientists/engineers from Analytical, R&D, and other disciplines, such as process engineering and production, to advance synthetic routes into commercial processes.
Track record of innovative thinking and technical accomplishments and utilization of analytical tools, technical knowledge, data, computational and statistical tools, etc. to solve technical challenges and enhance chemistries and process development.
Proficient in standard analytical techniques (TLC, NMR, HPLC, LC/MS, GC, etc.) and separation technologies, such as distillation, column chromatography, and crystallization.
Able to perform independent research in a multidisciplinary environment and cooperatively as part of a multidisciplinary team.
Excellent organizational and communication (written and verbal) skills and the ability to effectively influence the work of others.
Interpret and communicate results to colleagues, company, and clients
Supervisory and mentoring skills.
Travel requirements: Travel is required on occasion in support of external manufacture or to participate in scientific conferences.
Salary and Benefits: Salary level is commensurate with experience, competitive with comparable professionals. Package includes full medical and dental health insurance, with 100% of premiums paid by the company. 401K with company match, AD&D, Life Insurance, vacation, paid holidays, and sick time.
Wiley Companies is an equal opportunity employer and is dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination upon the basis of age, race, gender, creed, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, political belief, or disability. Candidates must be legal residents of the United States and have legal work status through citizenship or work visa. Candidates must pass a drug screen prior to employment.'

JOB POSTING: CHEMIST
The Research and Development department is paramount in the success of the business by formulating, testing, and analyzing the materials in its most organic compound and developing sustainable and/or the best materials for the final product suitable for residential and commercial use.
This position is a leadership role in polyurethane formulation chemistry, making coated samples, and testing these with necessary chemical and mechanical tests. We will rely heavily on the technical expertise of such chemistries and the resultant coatings created. Additionally, this role must keep the entire chemistry and formulation process from beginning to end in strict confidence.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
· Plan and develop products and achieve cost-performance optimization for both existing and new products.
· Provide technical oversight and expertise as required.
· Oversee the entire development process of new products and programs within an organization, from the initial planning phase to implementation or production.
· Keep the entire development process of new, current, and old products confidential from the public and competitors. Only approved need to know individuals will have access to the process upon Owner’s written approval.
· Coordinate with other departments to exchange, update products information.
· Evaluation of competitors’ products to compare with company’s similar products.
· Assist in sourcing and evaluating new raw materials to ensure products conformity and competitiveness.
· Document all R&D procedures and reports and monitor implemented programs to ensure efficient use of resource.
· Solve problems with the use of chemistry, instrumentation, computers, and statistics, and interpret data while being able to communicate results to Owner.
Strong knowledge of concrete, polymer coatings, pigments, vinyl, UV stabilizers, and other coatings and additives along with a familiarity of the lab and production-scale processing.
Manage detailed, professional QC processes, from raw material intake to final product formulations.
Troubleshoot, clean, and maintain laboratory equipment and supplies.
Follow laboratory SOPs to prepare and test samples using traditional laboratory technologies.
Accurately interpret and record data in an organized, legible, and consistent manner.
Verify lab equipment before use to ensure they are within acceptable limits.
Perform special projects, as assigned.
Experience and Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree or higher in Chemistry or Polymer Chemistry or Chemical Engineering
Minimum 5 years of working experience and 3 years of relevant experience in R&D laboratory field
Strong knowledge of construction chemicals including Polyurethane and/or Polyaspartic
Able to work as part of a team in a fast-paced environment
Able to interact professionally with colleagues and bring up concerns immediately when you are faced with them
Great written and verbal communication skills
Excellent laboratory troubleshooting skills
Detail and accuracy oriented
Compensation:
$100k-$130k depending on experience, qualifications, skillsets

JOB DESCRIPTION
Job Title:
Analytical Chemist
Job Purpose:
Provide high-level analytical chemistry expertise to the company. Lead scientist for the laboratory’s operation and associated instrumentation. Serve as a back-up to the
Laboratory Director.
Job Duties:
Reporting to the Laboratory Director, the Analytical Chemist is responsible for all aspects of the laboratory including operation, maintenance, troubleshooting, data collection and analysis, and reporting/presenting of chemical and analytical output.
Devise technically competent test methods and study protocols, execute the studies, and create clear, concise reports in a timely manner.
Develop chromatographic and mass spectral methods for current and emerging business opportunities, e.g., development of acid hydrolysis (e.g., HCl, HF,
HNO3) microwave digestion methods for ICP-MS sample preparation.
Communicate as needed with clients to clarify requirements
Keep UPLC/MS, ICP-MS, and GC/MS instrumentation operational for successful daily use by maintaining laboratory supplies and performing routine maintenance and weekly surveillance.
Handle a range of organic chemical sample preparations, syntheses, and polymerizations utilizing organic solvents (e.g., tetrahydrofuran, acetonitrile, toluene, methylene chloride) and monomers (methyl methacrylate, other acrylate monomers).
Perform physical duties such as routine instrumentation maintenance, e.g., replace vacuum pump oil, interchange compressed gas cylinders and dewars, maintain solvent supplies for analytical equipment.
Travel as required for training, conference booth attendance, and client meetings.
Support the maintenance and promotion of the InVision Biomedical Quality
System and Quality Objectives
Skills/Qualifications:
Demonstrated ability to define an analytical problem, devise the program to solve problem, and execute the program to completion.
Strong oral and written communication skills. Must be fluent in English.
Good computer skills including Word, Excel, and instrument software.

Essential is a privately owned company that sells its ability to help companies create their next-generation coatings. We expect to deliver our customers a WOW experience when working with us. We believe in the challenge of problem-solving and that learning from our mistakes is more powerful than learning from our successes. We find it fun to discover new solutions, invent new polymers and technologies, and work with our customers to find new and creative ways to solve their problems.
Job Profile:
Join our R&D polymer team at Essential Industries as a Chemist I.
This team member will be responsible for developing new water-based acrylic emulsion polymers and polyurethane dispersions to fit the customer's needs. They will be responsible for developing the polymer and evaluating its performance in a starting point formulation. They will also be responsible to work with the process engineers and chemical operators to scale up the formulations from lab to pilot to full production.
Key Responsibilities
Assist in the analysis of all Essential’s products, intermediates, and raw materials to ensure they meet specifications and customer requirements.
Ensure all required QC tests are performed in coordination with the production schedule.
Assist in the data entry of the Quality Control results.
Operate and maintain QC instrumentation in a safe and professional manner.
Assist in developing polymers for the coatings industries.
Assist in formulating the polymers into a coatings formulation and then perform the appropriate physical testing and report the results.
Qualifications and Skills:
BA, BS in Polymer Chemistry, Organic Chemistry or related field.
0-3 years experience in emulsion polymerization, polyurethane dispersions or a closely related field.
Effective communication with internal teams, as well as with customers.
Understanding and the use of Design of Experiments is a plus.
Ability to perform intermediate mathematical calculations, such as stoichiometry.
Microsoft Office experience
Having a passion to solve problems by developing new and innovative solutions.
Physical Requirements:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. This requires the ability to lift, move bend, and stand, as well as lift 20+ lbs as necessary.

Job description
POSITION DETAILS:
Spectrix Analytical Services, LLC is seeking highly motivated individual to fill a full time position performing routine small molecule purification using a variety of automated prep chromatography methods. The positions will be located at our client’s biopharmaceutical research facility in San Diego, CA.
Under the direction of the laboratory manager, the Purification Scientist will analyze incoming crude novel compounds (5-100 mg) from medicinal chemists by UPLC/MS, develop and implement purification methods, and isolate the purified products by analytical UPLC/MS. The Purification Scientist will also help maintain and troubleshoot instruments, perform routine laboratory process and maintenance tasks, and communicate results to customers.
EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:
Selected candidates will be required to
Possess a minimum of a B.S. degree in chemistry, biochemistry, or other physical science with 2-5 years of industrial laboratory experience or a M.S. degree in a similar field. This is not a doctorate level position.
Have a college level understanding of organic chemistry and instrumental analysis including UV/Vis, chromatography and mass spectrometry.
Possess excellent written and oral communication skills.
Work collaboratively in a team oriented environment, interacting with a variety of departments.
Follow all laboratory and workplace safety requirements.
Demonstrate excellent customer service.
The ideal candidate will also have
Laboratory experience outside of those associated with class work (internship, co-op, independent project) preferably in organic or analytical chemistry.
Hands on experience with HPLC, and LC/MS.
Hand on experience with SFC, preferred.
Strong instrument operating skills and computer proficiency.
Spectrix offers flexible schedules, competitive salaries, and a committed work environment to its employees; the company provides automatic benefits of life insurance and short and long term disability insurance. Optional benefits for full time employees include health, dental, and vision insurance, college loan assistance, and an employer matched retirement savings plan. Spectrix is not a placement agency. Spectrix is participating in the E-Verify program of the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (phone number: 888-897-7781, and website: www.dhs.gov/E-Verify).

Job Description
Vertex Pharmaceuticals has an exciting opportunity for a research scientist in the field of medicinal chemistry. Job responsibilities include the preparation of both single and focused sets of small organic molecules, developing and optimizing synthetic methods, creating and interpreting project-relevant Structure-Activity Relationship (SAR) and problem solving. Candidates must demonstrate an expert understanding of organic reaction mechanisms, formulation of executable synthetic routes, up to date understanding of contemporary synthetic methods as well as an ability to balance rational concepts with creativity which includes the development of new synthetic methodology as needed. The successful candidate will have the ability to work independently and be able to multi-task collaboratively in teams while adapting to rapidly changing needs. A strong desire to grow as a medicinal chemist while maintaining a passion for organic chemistry and the courage to challenge conventional wisdom are essential in this role.
Key Responsibilities:
Maintain a high level of productivity in the laboratory setting
Develops and executes clear synthetic routes using state-of-the-art synthetic methodologies
Primarily responsible for executing organic syntheses in a timely, efficient, and independent manner
Create and interpret SAR with a clear understanding of the biological data
Organize and triage efforts to stay consistent with project priorities
Clearly and effectively communicate ideas and results (both verbally and in writing) to a broad range of audiences
Knowledge and Skills:
Designs and executes complex, challenging chemistry experiments
Demonstrates astute understanding of his/her own discipline and the relevant literature
Maintains a high level of knowledge related to current developments in the scientiﬁc Project ﬁeld

Job Title: Associate Chemist for the Toxicology Lab
Job Description:
Are you an experienced Medical Lab Professional? Are you looking to embark on a new challenge in your career, or start your career in Medical Lab Science? If so, LabCorp wants to speak with you about exciting opportunities to join our team as an Associate Chemist in the Toxicology department in Burlington, NC. In this position you will work in a fast paced, customer focused, and challenging environment, and will be a part of our overall mission at LabCorp: "Improving Health, Improving Lives".
The Toxicology department consists of 4 sub departments: Toxicology, Biological Monitoring, Blood Lead and Mass Spectrometry. These have a combined volume of approximately 500,00 tests a month. Our toxicology tests are primarily focused on therapeutic drug monitoring, our biological monitoring tests focus on metal or chemical exposures and our mass spec department is our most rapidly growing area and encompasses testing from several disciplines from toxicology to endocrinology. The Toxicology department offers experience with many types of analytical instrumentation such as GC, GC/MS, HPLC, ICP/MS and LC/MS/MS as well as with automated and manual systems of sample preparation. Position is in the LC/MS Data Review/Operator Section of Toxicology. Position will be responsible for reviewing and certifying LC/MS data utilizing Analyst and Ascent software.
The schedule for the position will be 1st shift (Monday-Friday 8am-4:30pm)
Job responsibilities:
Manage calibration, quality controls, and patient data up to and including result entry.
Performs minor troubleshooting/repair and instrument prep of LC/MS systems
Gains knowledge of department operations and procedures under direct supervision and in an entry-level capacity.
Conducts qualitative and quantitative analyses on organic and inorganic samples to determine their chemical properties.
Participates in development of new analytical procedures.
Gains knowledge of department operations and procedures.
Requirements:
Bachelor's Science in Biology, Chemistry, Medical Technology or related Life Science.
Must have at least 3 years of clinical laboratory experience with preference given for Chromatographic Data Review experience.
Attention to detail.
Knowledge of automated and manual systems of sample preparation.

At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.
Medicinal Chemistry – Associate Director
We are seeking a talented and highly motivated individual with a strong background in medicinal chemistry to join our Small Molecule Drug Discovery team.
The successful candidate will lead a team of medicinal chemists and engage in rational design of new agents for the potential treatment in cardiovascular disease. The individual will apply modern drug design principles including machine learning approaches to solve medicinal chemistry problems relevant to the cardiovascular discovery portfolio. Furthermore, you will collaborate with a broad group of scientists within BMS to advance the projects from inception to IND enabling studies. Knowledge and experience in cardiovascular diseases or genetic based diseases is a plus. The successful chemist will interface with an excellent team of scientists in biology, biochemistry, structural biology, computational sciences and translational development.
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree and 12+ years of academic or industry experience
OR
Master’s Degree and 10+ years of academic or industry experience
OR
PhD and 8+ years of academic or industry experience
And
4+ years of leadership experience
Preferred Qualifications:
Ph.D. in synthetic organic chemistry with 8+ years industry / pharmaceutical medicinal chemistry industrial experience and 4+ years of leadership experience.
Proven track record of supervising PhD level scientists to high levels of productivity, whilst improving the skills and knowledge of direct reports through mentorship and focused development activities
Demonstrated track record of leadership advancing programs through all stages of drug discovery to support IND-enabling studies or demonstrated success starting early discovery programs
Proven leadership capability in cross-functional teams, either as project team leader or co-leader
Track record of innovation and impact on programs documented through co-inventorship on issued patents and authorship of publications in peer-reviewed journals is necessary (may include both successful advances and data-driven terminations)
Strong working knowledge of protein-ligand interactions, conformational and structural analysis, experienced in partnering closely with computational chemists through appropriate use of computational tools and models as well as visualization applications
High level of creativity and productivity with strong synthetic problem-solving skills, synthetic methods, and reaction mechanisms are required
Ability to champion chemistry efforts into new directions to achieve project milestones
Strong skills in gathering, documenting, and analyzing information from competitive sources such as patents and meetings and using this information to guide program strategy
Experience working in cardiovascular or genetic based diseases is desired, but not required
Broad knowledge of the drug discovery and development process
Excellent written and oral communication skills demonstrated ability to write peer reviewed quality work or invention disclosures for patent applications, and able to present the rationale, key data, issues and accomplishments department wide
Fit with BMS Culture and Values
Diversity and inclusion
Strong team orientation; highly collaborative
Solutions and results-oriented focus
Hands-on approach; resourceful and open to diverse points of view

A well-respected and established innovative corporation is looking to add a Postharvest Chemist to their team. This individual be focused on the development of vaporizing chemicals for organic and conventional horticultural crops in response to innovative technology. The individual in this position will identify potential actives for vaporization and/or volatilization, formulate fungicides, insecticides, and sanitizers for commercialization and determine the ideal conditions within the range of gas compositions and pressure to be used for holding perishables.
Postharvest Chemist Responsibilities:
Carry out vigorous and dynamic research focused on vaporizing single and multicomponent mixtures
Plan, organize and conduct experiments to develop pesticides (fungicides and insecticides) and sanitizers via vaporization and/or volatilization under vacuum.
Execute quality analyses in response to vaporized and/or volatized chemicals.
Monitoring and providing advice to optimize the parameters required for each mixture in concert with the research team.
Design experimental trials in laboratory and commercial scales.
Responsible for identifying, evaluating potential actives and carrier(s) from natural origin and synthetic chemistry.
Ensuring that the research and development activities will draw upon practical knowledge of chemistry to investigate the response to the technology that extend shelf life and quality with the goal of delaying senescence of harvested horticultural crops.

Gelest, Inc., part of the Mitsubishi Chemical Corporation, is seeking qualified individuals to join our small and large-scale production operations as a Process Chemist.
Gelest is a specialty chemical company that has been experiencing steady growth which results in a fast paced and challenging work environment. Gelest provides hands on equipment training by our technical staff as well as training in the areas of synthetic chemistry and silicone polymer chemistry. The Process Chemist must possess the knowledge and ability to perform all duties associated with the small and large scale production of specialty chemicals.

Responsibilities:
This position requires the following physical and mental demands consisting of, but not limited to the following:
Process development, scale-up and manufacturing of various organosilanes, silicones and metal-organic compounds on a scale from 1 liter to multi-tons.
Independently carry out chemical reactions, perform purification techniques and evaluate analytical results of synthesized products.
Follow the prescribed processes for the synthesis and purification of organosilanes and metal organic compounds in a safe manner.
Record detailed descriptions, including comments, for potential improvements of the work done.
Perform preliminary and in-process analytical and paper works on reactions.
Operating various pieces of production and support equipment, handling drums of material, operating analytical equipment, forklifts and other equipment as needed.
Ability to use feedback from processes to make necessary adjustment to maintain safe and efficient output.
Work well in a team setting and be able to convey information about the status of reactions to others.
Subject to a production plant environment including noise, vibration, hazards, hot and cold atmospheric conditions and wearing a respirator when required.
Self-motivated and willing to learn in a dynamic fast paced environment.
What We Offer:
Paid company holidays
Vacation and Sick Leave.
401k with 50% company match.
Medical, Dental, Vision, Accident and Critical Illness plans for employee and family.
Company paid Life Insurance, AD&D Insurance, Short Term Disability and Long Term Disability.
Annual Bonus
Student Loan Assistance and Tuition Assistance
Company provided Uniforms, Work Boots and PPE.
Gelest is located in Morrisville, PA and is in close proximity to Interstate 95, Route 1 and the PA/NJ turnpikes.
Minimum 2 years college chemistry required, Bachelor's degree preferred, or equivalent experience
Shiftwork (2nd of 3rd Shift) may be required.
Lifting/Carrying - Frequent lifting of up to and over 50 lbs.
Pushing/Pulling/Climbing – Must be able to push a drum truck, use equipment to tip over drums and climb stairs.
Able to operate or learn to operate a forklift
Walking/Continuous standing
Be aware of fire, safety and chemical hazards. Wear personal protective equipment as needed.
Pass respirator fit test as required by OSHA
Must be able to hear and respond to all communications and alarms
Must be able to read instructions, SDS and interpret packaging codes
May be required to work overtime
Work and communicate well with other departments
Responsible for operating various hand tools and pumps in a safe manner
To function as a member of the safety committee or emergency response team if required
Maintain positive and pleasant attitude with all coworkers.
Responsible for maintaining cleanliness and good working conditions of all work areas
Other duties as determined by management

Organic Chemist
1) Responsible for timely and proper execution of any research project as

Distillation to QC, as assigned by the R&D Director. You must keep the R&D
Director fully apprised of any successes, issues or failures. The
communication must be continuous and timely.

able to perform 3 to 6 major events per day (3 reactions, or 2 distillations + one reaction, etc).

precautions, and making recommendations for process improvements and changes.

intermediates, calculating yields and paperwork necessary for documenting
completed processes.

and equipment malfunctioning.

preparing finished goods for orders and sensory evaluations.
13) Responsible for having an understanding of the chemistry involved in
research projects and processes under development. Should use this
knowledge to troubleshoot problems and make suggestions to the R&D
Director for process changes and new development.

Perform testing activities to support purification process
